De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On Cauterization for Epilepsy. (Note: The title suggests that this chapter will discuss the use of cauterization to treat epilepsy)
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	Cauterization is not performed on an epileptic unless the seizure is caused by abscess. (Note: The text suggests that cauterization should only be used to treat epilepsy if it is caused by an underlying infection or abscess)
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And so, it is necessary to cleanse the brain of the patient at the beginning with yarrow and other treatments as I have mentioned in the division when the illness is severe and the patient can tolerate the removal of medications. (Note: The text suggests that initial treatment for epilepsy caused by abscess should include cleansing of the brain and removal of any unnecessary or harmful medications)
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if the patient is a child who cannot tolerate medications, then administer purifying and chewing gum until it has healed for several days, along with nutritious foods. (Note: The text suggests that when medication cannot be used, alternative treatments such as purifying agents and chewing gum can be helpful in treating epilepsy in children)
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And approach the patient's head, and cauterize it with a cautery at the middle of the head in the previous manner, and with another cautery on the occiput of them, and each horn of the head is cauterized.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerant, then cauterize them with cauteries as I have mentioned, while they are in a state of paralytic relaxation and softening of the body on the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And use an olive-shaped cautery, as has been described before.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then use a subtle cautery in this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupt and thickened humors, then cauterize them with the cauteries that I have mentioned while they are in a state of paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is an excess that tends towards melancholy, and the patient's body is humid, then give them to drink something that purifies their brain according to what has been described in the division (i.e., the previous section).
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And approach the patient's head, and properly make a turtle-dove shape from them over the circle, and then place it in the middle of their head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient be sixty years old and be held in check from all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And apply a liniment; it is more appropriate to use an antidote made from sheep's wool.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And warm that over the fire with moderate heat, which will alleviate the suffering when it is applied to them.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And place that in the middle of their head within the circle, and leave it there until it has cooled.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this with the patient once a week, along with any other beneficial treatment until they are healed; or if you prefer, cauterize them with small points as needed, provided that your hand is always ready with a cautery in this manner: this is a type of cautery that moistens the brain with equal measure.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And apply that piece soaked in an antidote made from wool or linen.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On the cauterization of fluids descending into the lung.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have determined the onset of fluid in the lung by the signs that I have mentioned in the division (i.e., the previous section), then begin and give the patient to drink something that purifies their head, and keep them away from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And cause them to sweat in a bath for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And command them to shave their head, and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of their head; and then cauterize it with two cauteries on both temples if it is the beginning of fluid in both lungs, or with one cautery on one temple if it is the beginning of fluid in one lung.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Incise with a cautery all the veins and arteries that are located below the collarbone; and let the cauteries be in that place in the width of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be on guard against bleeding when cauterizing; and if you see that there is bleeding, stop it with some medicine, whatever is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will bring wisdom in the extraction of arteries and in the incision of those and caution against bleeding.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized in the back of the neck, below two bones, with two well-produced cauteries.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On the cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears of the eyes are old and persistent, and it has been verified that this is due to excess phlegmatic humors in the veins and arteries that are in the manifest location on the outside of the head, then cauterize with a cautery as I have described in the chapter on the beginning of fluid entering the lungs. Cauterize also in the middle of the forehead, and with two cauteries at the back of the neck below the temples, and with two cauteries at the back of the neck below the skull.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you need to make an addition, then cauterize that place on the side of the leg near the hip at the end of the spine with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On cauterization for nasal foul smell.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat that with what we have said in the division and your treatment is not effective, then you should prepare and give to the patient a drink made from crushed cochineal insects for three nights; and then shave the patient's head and cauterize the area with a medium-sized olive-shaped cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize that place with a nail-shaped cautery, using two cauteries on the sides of the spine just below the hairline.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn the spine with the cautery.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the shape of the nail-shaped cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the use of cautery for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye becomes soft due to illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a round-shaped cautery; and this is its shape:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you do this, then cauterize that place on the sides of the eyebrows with two small cauteries, one on each side, and make them long in shape.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the size of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but only as much as is necessary for the outer third of the eyelid to be burned.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the use of cautery for the eyelid of the eye when the eyelashes turn inward and poke the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the eyelashes of the eye turn inward so that they poke the eye, there are two ways to use cautery to treat this condition: either with fire or with a burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you use a cautery with fire, then command the patient to read their eyelashes as if they were cleaning them, until they are long and curled; and if it pokes the eye, then you should strengthen the eyes of the patient with a bandage so that no harm is done until the lashes have grown back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	And when they have grown back and are curled, then place the head of the patient in your lap, and place a sign on the eyelids of the eyes of the patient with a mark, with a sign that is in the shape of a myrtle leaf, and let the beginning of the sign be near the lashes.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And place a piece of cotton soaked in egg white or mucilage of gelatin on the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And place the hot iron cautery, which has this shape:
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And place the cautery on the marked shape, little by little, in a measured manner, until the surface of the eyelid is burned, which should look like a myrtle leaf, completely apparent.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And the sign of health for this treatment is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted and the eyelashes lifted upwards above the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then lift your hand and leave it there for three days, and place a bandage over the cotton so that the scar can heal.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And apply a salve to it until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if it returns by any cause to its origin and the eyelid is swollen, then apply the cautery again to it as you did before.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the eyelashes are inside the lower eyelid, then cauterize the area to raise it back to its natural location, apply a salve and ensure the lashes do not touch the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But if you use a heated cautery with medicine, order the patient to pull out their lashes and apply a salve so they are pulled out and formed like a myrtle leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And take known soap and fresh cow dung in equal parts. I understand, this seems to be an abbreviation for "id est", meaning "that is" or "in other words".[interpretation] And do this quickly so it is not hardened, and spread some of the mixture on a piece of paper shaped like a myrtle leaf, and place it over the eye or both eyes; and place below the eye a small cloth bag filled with alum dissolved in egg white, and let the patient's head be in your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place the patient's finger on the medicine and press gently until they feel a stinging sensation from the medicine, for this stinging is to them as if it were fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And when they perceive that the stinging sensation has stopped, then remove the medicine and take their finger away; once the stinging stops, leave the medicine on for a while longer and then wash the eye with water. Then consider whether the eyelid is now raised as it should be due to the constriction from fire or incision, if so then it is well. But if not, reapply the medicine to the area where it has not been applied and do not let it wear off until your treatment is complete and the eye is healed.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And apply a compress soaked in a solution to the area until the swelling from the abscess is eliminated, and treat the wound with an appropriate salve or other remedy until it heals.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you to carefully monitor your treatment and ensure that no residue of the medicine enters the eye during the procedure. If the eyelid remains swollen for several days or if any lashes grow into the eye, then reapply the medicine to the affected area using the same method as before. Continue this treatment until the condition is completely resolved.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the shape of a myrtle leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the eyes of men are differentiated by size and smallness, and so too should your treatment be adapted accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And it is not hidden from those who study this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of cauterization for fistulas in the lacrimal duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula with the method we have discussed in previous chapters and do not see improvement, then it is appropriate to use cauterization. The patient should position their head in your lap, and a minister should hold their head in such a way that they are not harmed or disturbed by moving their head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And apply a compress soaked in egg white or powdered cheese to the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And apply the heated cautery, which has this shape:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	The end of the cautery should be concave, with a shape similar to that of a reed or vulture's feather, at the end where it is made into a cautery.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, it should penetrate through to the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to come out as it tries.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, one that is concave is better for this type of work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And apply pressure to the fistula if it is open, and draw out any pus or fluids and dry it out.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then you should open it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then apply the heated cautery to it, ensuring that it is well lit and held close to the eye, but not touching the eye itself, near the nose where you can control your hand and prevent any discomfort or disturbance to the patient. Then apply the cautery to the grooves of the eye and destroy any abnormal growths there.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so, if at the beginning of your cauterization you penetrate into the bone, that is good; but if not, then continue to apply the cautery once or twice more if necessary, and leave it in place for three days. Afterwards, apply a compress soaked in a drying salve until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if ten days have passed and it has not healed, then apply a sharp corrosive medicine to reveal the bone and scrape it as necessary according to what is appropriate in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	Here is another method of cauterization for a fistula which we have already mentioned: understand the location of the fistula and open it up, then apply the cautery gently to the opening in the following manner: The shape of the cautery should be like this (here a sketch or diagram would be helpful), and make it with one ounce of molten lead; hold your hand firmly with caution, ensuring that the molten lead does not touch the eye of the patient; and place a compress soaked in egg white or water over the patient's eye, as lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it through miraculous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we mentioned about cautery and treatment, that's good; otherwise, it is necessary to administer nose drops and reduce the fistula to the cavity of the nose, as will come in its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cauterization of wounds on the feet.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Often happens that fissures occur in the lips, and more commonly in the lips of infants.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you cure those fissures with what we mentioned in the previous sections and your treatment is not effective, then use the pointed cautery knife as follows, according to this form that is taught:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let its cavity be according to the fineness of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place that end carefully into those fissures until the cautery reaches the bottom of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	Then cure it with cerates until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cauterization of fistulas in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an abscess develops in the root of the uvula or in the palate or in the roots of the teeth, and it bursts open and becomes old and corrupted, and pus flows out and forms a fistula, and if you cure that and your treatment is not effective, then you must cauterize the fistula with a hot iron according to its size. And place the hot iron in the opening of the fistula and put your hand inside until the heated iron reaches the bottom of it, and after doing this once or twice; and then cure it with what we mentioned earlier about treatment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And therefore, if the pus has been cut out and it is healed, that's good; but if not, then it is necessary to reveal the location and remove the decayed bone as will come in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cauterization of teeth and the softening of stiff joints.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the joints are softened by moisture and the teeth are decayed, and you cure those with medicines but they do not work, then place the patient's head in your lap and use a cautery of the following shape: heat the probe until it is red hot and quickly place it on the tooth while holding the heated part against the tooth. Hold the probe there for a short time until the patient feels the heat from the fire reach the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift your hand away, and then repeat the cautery several times as you desire.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then have the patient fill their mouth with salt water and hold it there for an hour, and then spit it out, because the decayed tooth is closed and the softened gum is strengthened and the corrupt moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the Cautery of Tooth Pain
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to coldness or there is a crack or worm in it, and the treatment with medicine does not work, then you should cauterize it in two ways: either by using a cow's blood cautery or by using fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	To cauterize with cow's blood, you should take the blood of cows and boil it in a pot of iron, then quickly take a piece of cloth and wrap it around the end of the probe. Next, immerse that in the boiling blood and place it on the painful tooth quickly before it cools down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat that several times until the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, immerse wool or cloth in the aforementioned cow's blood and place it on the painful tooth, and place the red-hot iron on top of that until the iron reaches the bottom of the recess of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, the cauterization with fire is that you pay attention to the tip of iron or steel, and it should have some roughness on it, and the intensity of the fire should not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then heat the cautery of a shape that will come, and place it on the tooth while holding your hand so that the cautery becomes cool; and do this several times until the pain is reduced or on that day or the following day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary that, through the impression of that cautery, the patient fills their mouth with good broth and keeps it there for an hour, and then spits it out; and this is the method of cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize whatever extremity you are able to.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the cannula.[Note: A cannula was a type of surgical instrument used in medieval medicine, similar to a trocar or large needle, often used for draining fluids from the body.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cannula_(medicine))
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.[Note: This is likely just referring to a new section or chapter in the text, with "Capitol" being short for "Capitulum", the Latin word for "chapter".]
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cauterization of umbilical hernias (extrophulos).[Note: An umbilical hernia is a protrusion of the abdominal lining or part of the intestine through the navel. "Extrophulos" may be a variation in spelling for this type of hernia, as it was sometimes referred to as an "exstrophy of the umbilicus" in medieval medical texts.](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5842013/)
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When umbilical hernias (extrophulos) are caused by inflammation and cold humors, and they are not obedient to gentle digestion through medicines, and you wish to perform gentle digestion on them, then use a cautery of this shape: it should have two sharp ends so that the smoke from the cautery can be directed towards the hernia by the other end. Place the burning cautery over the swelling once, and if necessary, repeat this until you reach the core of the hernia.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the abscess is small, then cauterize it according to its size, and then leave it alone for three days and place a compress soaked in broth over it until the pus that the fire has burned away has been released.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with ointment, bandages, and cloths until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the cannula or cautery for this purpose is as follows:
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cauterization of laryngitis and constriction of the throat.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humors come to the throat of the lung, especially when this is accompanied by feverish complications, then it is necessary for the patient to be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize the affected area at the root of the throat in the depressed location.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And make sure that you do not reach the windpipe with the cautery or burn through the cartilage of it, but only slightly.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And then cauterize it with another cautery at the joint of the neck at the last vertebra of the spine.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And let the cautery be a small nail, according to the previous manner.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with what has been previously described until it is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On the cauterization of lung disease and coughing.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and lung disease are caused by cold humors, and the patient does not have a fever or tuberculosis, and it is an old illness, then cauterize it with two cauteries on the collarbone in the depressed locations between the lion's teeth and the boils; and with another cautery in the middle of the chest between the two nipples; and let the cauteries be shaped like small nails according to the previous form.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, let your cauterization be punctate with the cautery called "puncta," whose shape is described in the treatment for ear pain.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And let there be holes in these [cauteries], and then cure it with what has been previously described until it is healed.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And let the cauteries have three prongs, because cauterization is done with one of them: with one application you can make three cauteries according to this form:
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On the cauterization of titillicus, which is the head of the appendix.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the appendix is dislocated due to slippery humors and does not return to its proper place at the appropriate time, then you should wait until it returns on its own, as it usually will. But if, as we have seen, it becomes dislocated again with a small movement, then it is necessary to first reduce the dislocation by gently pressing on the area around the appendix and returning it to its proper position. Then, the patient should be positioned on their side or back, and the neck should be raised using the hand on the left side if the joint is displaced towards the inside.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then ignite the cautery with two handles, and this is its shape:
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	And then cauterize the neck until it penetrates to the other side, and this is the figure of the cauterization with four cautery points.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	and it should be subtle according to the amount of tension; and this is its shape:
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And sometimes it is adjusted according to this count and therefore there are eight cauteries.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	And then place a porous cushion soaked with salt on the cautery, and then make the patient rest calmly and avoid moving the affected limb for some time until it is healed.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	And if the dislocation is towards the upper part and is done late, then cauterize over the muscle with a small nail-shaped cautery or with multiple punctate cauteries, because the joint is strengthened, the humidity is eliminated, and the patient is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De cauterizacio del stomac.	On the cauterization of the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When excess moisture and motions come into the stomach from its composition and are multiplied within it, and you continue with treatment methods but do not see improvement, then it is necessary for the patient to lie on their back, extend their arms and legs, and cauterize it with three cauteries: one below the belly button the size of a finger using a small nail-shaped cautery, and two more below each side of the first cautery, forming a triangular shape; leave spaces between them so that they do not touch, which will cause burning.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery is the quantity of two thirds of the thickness of the neck.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And let the shape of the cautery be in this form, as shown above. If you wish, cauterize with a large cautery in the middle of the stomach according to this form; and this should be a cautery shaped like a circle according to this form:
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And let the stomach be punctate cauterized with this [small] cautery for those who are afraid of it: that is, place the cautery point on the stomach according to the quantity you desire with tension, and then cauterize it with a small cautery at the points; and then cure it with the cure that has been previously described until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	On the cauterization of a cold fester.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When pain occurs in the fester due to coldness or moisture or excessive gas that is expelled from its normal composition, and the patient does not improve with the treatment we have described, then it is necessary for the patient to lie on their back, and place three cauteries of this shape and size over the fester below the hypochondria, where the body's weight rests.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And let the space between each cautery be according to the thickness of the body part, and let the cauteries be according to the length of the straight body part.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not press too hard with the cautery.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the quantity of that which adheres is equal to the size of the width of the spine, and it is not fitting; and if the patient is standing on their feet; and if they are not standing, then let them lie down, having extended their limbs, and raised their arms.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And it is possible for you to cauterize these cauteries with a surgical knife, when you have skill and prudence in the art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And be careful not to overdo it in the cauterization, and let the width of the entire spine be cauterized so that all the body is cauterized and reaches the intestines, for here the spine is delicate; and know this.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter twenty eight.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	On the perforation of an abscess of the liver with a cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When an abscess forms in the liver and you wish to know if it is in the flesh of the liver or in its membrane, then if it is in the flesh of the liver, the patient will experience heaviness and dull pain without intensification.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the membrane of the liver, with pain being intensified greatly and often causing doctors to tire from treating it.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore it is necessary that the patient be positioned facing down on their chest; and then locate the site of the abscess with your finger; and then ignite the cautery which has the shape of a spear, the form of which was previously shown on the previous page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And cauterize with that pointed cautery until the entire spine is compressed, until it reaches the diaphragm, until pus emerges.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And treat it with treatment for other abscesses until it is healed.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And it is not necessary to use this form of cautery except for those who have studied medicine for a long time and have recognized many illnesses; but let this person proceed with caution in this operation, but also leave some room for error, and it is better.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter twenty nine.
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On the cauterization of pleurisy.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	The ancients used to cauterize pleurisy with the rods of ironworking in this manner: take a dry rod from the forge, one that is pointed and long, and of finger thickness.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	And then immerse that in oil and heat it in the fire, and then cauterize with a pointed cautery on the spot between the continuation of the collarbone with the neck; and with two small cauteries below, one slightly declining to the side that is beneath the chin, and two cauteries on the part that is declining between the fifth rib and the spine, declining slightly to the back; and another on the middle location of the chest; and another on the stomach, and three on the sides in the back; and one cautery at the location between the two shoulders, and two on both sides of the hips below the cautery that is between the shoulders;
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And it is not necessary to press hard with the cautery, but rather let it be in contact with the spine while working.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And some ancients said that others among men used a cautery of iron similar to a spear and ignited it, placing it in the location between the ribs until they reached the abscess and pus was expelled, just as we have mentioned in the liver abscess.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	But in this perforation with cautery there is danger, for one may die suddenly if the procedure is performed at a location where a fistula has formed that cannot be healed.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter thirty.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	On the cauterization of the spleen.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you cure the illness of the spleen with what we have said in the division, and do not change your treatment, then cauterization is performed on it in three ways, all of which are correct; one way is to make three or four linear cauteries along the length of the spleen according to the figure of the liver cauteries, the figure of which has been shown before.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And let there be a width of one finger or slightly more between each cautery, and the method of cauterization should be the same as that described in the liver cauteries.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not press too hard with the cautery; and let the patient be lying on their side.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	And there is another way to cauterize, which is to heat the cautery with two prongs, causing a swelling as we have mentioned in the chapter on muscle dislocation, and raise the spine which is in the middle of the spleen where the patient lies on their left side.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And let your lifting of the spine be according to the length of the body, so that cauteries are made according to the width of the body.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	And then insert the two prongs, heating them slightly, in that location where you penetrated the spine from the other side.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And then extract the cautery; and thus four cauteries are made.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you wish, cauterize with a trident-shaped cautery.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And then you cure the cautery more than ten days after it has been applied, for this is more beneficial than the other previous causes of healing.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	On cauterization for dropsy
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	The cautery should not be used in cases of dropsy, but rather specifically in ascites.
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	When you treat the dropsy patient with the methods of cure mentioned in the division, and if your treatment is not successful, then it is appropriate to cauterize them with four cauteries along the circumference of the belly and one cautery on the stomach, another on the liver, another on the spleen, two cauteries between the vertebrae of the back, one on the right side of the chest, and another on the stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And let the depth of the cautery be commensurate with the thickness of a thumb.
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	And let the cautery remain open for some time so that it continues to bleed for a long period of time.
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	And do not evacuate the patient during the treatment with the cautery in such a way that it is necessary for them to be evacuated afterwards, as this would add two intentions and hasten the need for additional assistance in healing.
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	The shape of the cautery used to cauterize the belly should be like a spike, as described above, and the shape of the cautery used to cauterize the back should be like an olive, as described previously.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32
De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	On cauterization for pain in the feet and thighs
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	When the feet become swollen with dropsy and are filled with serous fluid, it is necessary to cauterize them on the back of the foot near the knuckle between the ring finger and little finger, raising your hand with the cautery without twisting it; and furthermore, raise your hand without returning it completely, as the serous fluid will be expelled.
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar.	The cautery should be in the following form: and then make two cauteries on each thigh, and in each thigh a cautery should be made with the tip of a knife-like cautery.
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	And let the cauteries be in length according to that of the thigh, with one below the knee and the other below the middle of the thigh, and on each thigh two cauteries should be made.
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	And let the wound remain open without healing for a long time so that some fluid may drain from it.
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	And cure them with those methods that have been mentioned earlier.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	On Cautery of Abdominal Pain
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	When the abdomen is weakened and made soft by moisture to such an extent that it impairs its digestive and retentive functions, which are located in the stomach and intestines, then this condition should be treated with methods of healing, but if the patient is unable to tolerate these methods, then cauterize them with a large cautery on their stomach as described previously, with the circular cautery, and with four subtle cauteries along the subtle circumference of the belly, using a spike-like cautery; and use an olive-shaped cautery on the bladder, or two cauteries.
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	And if sometimes the moisture is excessive and the patient cannot tolerate it, then you should cauterize them on the pubic bone and on the intestines, and gently place two cauteries on the stomach and near the groin, as this is a perfect cure that will not fail.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34:
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	Chapter 34: Cautery of Old Hemorrhoids
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	When hemorrhoids are in a chronic state or are caused by thickened humors or corrupted moisture, and they have been treated with the methods described in the division without success, then you should cauterize them with three cauteries on the pus below the small triangular bone of the lower back and with a cautery above the navel at two points.
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	And if you suspect that the stomach is weakened and food is not being digested properly, and the face appears swollen, then cauterize them with a large cautery on their stomach as described previously, and also use a cautery on their liver, another on their spleen using a spike-like cautery, leave the cauteries open for some time, and continue to treat the patient until they are healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35:
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	Chapter 35: Cautery of Athel for Abscess Incision
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you apply the athel, then ignite the cautery that is shaped like a spearhead.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Then insert the ignited cautery into the incision made with athel, and direct your hand so that the cautery reaches the opening of the vein from which blood flows.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And do this once or twice, as if the abscesses are too numerous, then cauterize each of them as we have described, and treat those with ointments until they are healed.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	And if you perform cauterization using a large cautery on the skin, it is more helpful in providing relief.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36:
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	Chapter 36: Cautery of Fistulas that Occur in the Natural Parts of the Body
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When the natural processes do not follow the recommended course of action in their appropriate location and the patient is frightened by this, then they should be healed using cautery.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore, when you see a fistula in the natural parts of the body that is old and produces corrupt moisture and pus, then it is more appropriate to treat it with a subtle probe and to carefully determine the depth of the affected area using the previously mentioned probe.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Approach the cautery which resembles a spear. (based on context, "cautery" here likely refers to a hot iron instrument used in medieval medicine to cauterize or seal wounds)
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	Then apply that heated cautery into this fistula, according to the depth it reaches.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And move the cautery repeatedly inside until the corrupt parts are burned, once or twice or thrice, according to the degree of your need.[ (Note: "corrupt parts" may refer to damaged or infected tissue that needs to be removed)
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	And be careful not to burn nerve or vein; or if the fistula reaches the bladder's body or hernia's body, then be cautious of all those areas; and do not do so unless the fistula is in a fleshy area and you think it is not penetrating.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	Then heal the wound inside until it is healed.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the area is sealed and the materials have been cut away from it, and it remains like that for a long time, then know that it is cured completely. (Note: "sealed" may refer to the wound being closed or healed, while "materials" likely refers to any foreign substances or debris in the wound)
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the materials are not removed from it, then know that it is penetrating or in the swelling of it there is rotting flesh, or this happens because of those causes which will be mentioned later. (Note: "materials" likely refers to any foreign substances or debris in the wound)
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter thirty-seven. (Note: In medieval manuscripts, chapter numbers were often written out in full instead of using Arabic numerals)
De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	On the cauterization of tumors. (Note: "tumors" here likely refers to any abnormal swelling or lump on the body)
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When a tumor causes pain due to cold or due to its large size, and because of this the patient is in distress, then it is necessary to cauterize that tumor with a pointed cautery on each lump, taking care not to burn too deeply. (Note: "pointed cautery" likely refers to a hot iron instrument used in medieval medicine to cauterize or seal wounds) [ (Note: Here, "cove" is an archaic form of the verb "conviene", meaning "it is necessary")
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	And do a light cauterization with the second one just a little deeper, so that three parallel lines of cauterization are made, which will be more helpful later on. (Note: "light cauterization" may refer to a less severe form of cauterization or a smaller cautery instrument) [ (Note: Here, "fort leu" is an archaic phrase meaning "do lightly", while "diers" is an archaic form of the verb "dir", meaning "will be")[ (Note: The word "juvament" here likely means "helpful" or "beneficial")
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter thirty-eight. (Note: In medieval manuscripts, chapter numbers were often written out in full instead of using Arabic numerals)
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	On the cauterization of the bladder. (Note: "Cauterization" here likely refers to any medical procedure that involves burning or searing tissue with a heated instrument, while "bladder" may refer to the urinary bladder or another type of bladder in the body)
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When there is weakness and softening in the bladder due to cold and moisture, so that the patient cannot retain urine, then cauterize that area a little below the bladder where the pubic hair begins, with one cautery on each side of it. (Note: "cauterize" here likely refers to any medical procedure that involves burning or searing tissue with a heated instrument) [ (Note: The word "pentenilh" may refer to the public bone or area where pubic hair grows) [ (Note: Here, "dreyta" and "senestra" are archaic forms of the words "destra" and "sinistra", meaning "right" and "left" respectively)
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the size of the bladder, and cauterize that area a little below the spine with one cautery or two if necessary. (Note: Here, "not" may refer to the size or dimensions of the bladder) [ (Note: The phrase "am dos cauteris" means "with two cauteries")
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	And let the cautery be pointed as is appropriate for the procedure. (Note: Here, "clavilh" likely refers to a pointed or sharp instrument)
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter thirty-nine. (Note: In medieval manuscripts, chapter numbers were often written out in full instead of using Arabic numerals)
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	On the cauterization of the uterus. (Note: Here, "cauterization" likely refers to any medical procedure that involves burning or searing tissue with a heated instrument) [ (Note: The word "mayra" may refer to the uterus or womb)
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh. Capitol .xl.	Chapter forty. (Note: In medieval manuscripts, chapter numbers were often written out in full instead of using Arabic numerals)
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	On the cauterization for a dislocated ankle. (Note: Here, "cauterization" likely refers to any medical procedure that involves burning or searing tissue with a heated instrument) [ (Note: The word "dislocacio" may refer to a dislocation of the ankle joint, while "anqua" is an archaic form of the word "anca", meaning "ankle")
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moist humors are infiltrated into the area of the ankle, causing it to become swollen and displaced from its original position, and one sign of this is that one thigh appears longer than the other when compared to each other. (Note: Here, "moist humors" may refer to any fluid or moisture that has accumulated in the ankle joint due to injury or inflammation) [ (Note: The word "sieeu" here likely means "its", referring to the affected ankle joint)

Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Then it is necessary to cauterize the patient on the ankle with a circular-shaped cautery, as you will have marked with a probe along the circumference of the affected area, so that the affected part falls in the middle of the circle. E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if this cautery is not available to you, then cauterize with three large olive-shaped cauteries.
