Capitol .xli.	Chapter forty-one. (Note: In medieval manuscripts, chapter numbers were often written out in full instead of using Arabic numerals)
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On the cauterization for sciatic vein pain. (Note: Here, "cauterization" likely refers to any medical procedure that involves burning or searing tissue with a heated instrument) [ (Note: The word "sciatica" may refer to pain in the sciatic nerve, which runs from the lower back down to the legs)
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain occurs in the ankle area due to cold and moisture, then the patient is treated with the methods we have described and not otherwise, and these treatments are outdated. Therefore, it is necessary to purge the patient of thick humors using fetid pills or artificial ones, and then cauterize the affected area. (Note: Here, "cauterize" likely refers to any medical procedure that involves burning or searing tissue with a heated instrument) [ (Note: The phrase "am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz" means "with fetid pills or artificial pills or similar ones")[ (Note: The word "grosses" may refer to thick or viscous fluids in the body, such as phlegm or mucus)
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And there are two methods of cauterization for this condition: either using a burning medication or using fire. (Note: Here, "cauterization" likely refers to any medical procedure that involves burning or searing tissue with a heated instrument)
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	The method of cauterization is according to two known methods, one of which is to cauterize the affected area on the ankle with three triangular-shaped cauteries, as shown in this diagram, and make sure to penetrate deeply. (Note: Here, "cauterize" likely refers to any medical procedure that involves burning or searing tissue with a heated instrument) [ (Note: The word "triangulatz" may refer to a triangular shape or form) [ (Note: The phrase "fay am aquels bona profunditat" means "make sure to penetrate deeply") [ (Note: The word "diagram" is implied and not explicitly stated in the original text, but it is used here for clarity)
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And let the spaces between each cautery be equal to the width of a finger, and if the cauteries are olive-shaped or large. (Note: Here, "finger" may refer to the width or diameter of an average human finger) [ (Note: The phrase "olivar o gran" means "olive-shaped or large")[ (Note: The word "grossitut" may refer to the thickness or width of the cautery instrument)[ (Note: In this context, "spaci" likely refers to the spaces or gaps between each cautery)
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	And sometimes let some of the cauteries be on top of the middle of the ankle, so that there are four cauteries in total. (Note: Here, "cauteries" likely refers to any medical instrument used for burning or searing tissue)
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	And if you wish, you can use the circular-shaped cautery that we described in the treatment for a dislocated ankle, which should be a continuous circle and burn the thickness of the entire tendon. (Note: Here, "cauterize" likely refers to any medical procedure that involves burning or searing tissue with a heated instrument) [ (Note: The phrase "la i que sia cercle continent" means "which should be a continuous circle")[ (Note: The word "ispicitut" may refer to the thickness or diameter of the tendon)[ (Note: The phrase "precesida la forma" means "was described in the shape of")
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the method for using cautery in sciatica when pain is localized to the ankle and does not extend into the thigh. (Note: Here, "cautery" likely refers to any medical procedure that involves burning or searing tissue with a heated instrument)
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	But if the pain extends into the thigh, then cauterize with two cauteries on the thigh in the location where the patient feels pain, and one cautery on the shin four fingers' width above the back of the ankle. (Note: Here, "cauterize" likely refers to any medical procedure that involves burning or searing tissue with a heated instrument) [ (Note: The phrase "deves la part cilvestra" means "toward the outside")[ (Note: The word "shin" is used here for clarity and is not explicitly stated in the original text)
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if the cautery is a knife-shaped instrument, then let the depth of the cautery be according to the thickness of the tendon. (Note: Here, "cautery" likely refers to any medical instrument used for burning or searing tissue) [ (Note: The phrase "cutellar" means "knife-shaped")[ (Note: The word "ispicitut" may refer to the thickness or diameter of the tendon)[ (Note: The phrase "segon la quantitat de" means "according to the amount of")
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the patient feels that the pain is spreading to the area near the toes, then cauterize there with a three-pronged or four-pronged cautery or more as needed. (Note: Here, "cautery" likely refers to any medical instrument used for burning or searing tissue) [ (Note: The phrase "per tres puntz o quatre" means "with three prongs or four")[ (Note: The word "toes" is used here for clarity and is not explicitly stated in the original text) [ (Note: The phrase "si indigeys de aquel" means "if you need more than that")
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the patient feels pain below the groin near the thigh, then cauterize there with a knife-shaped cautery. (Note: Here, "cautery" likely refers to any medical instrument used for burning or searing tissue) [ (Note: The phrase "cutellar" means "knife-shaped")[ (Note: The word "groin" is used here for clarity and is not explicitly stated in the original text)
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And be careful in all cauterization procedures not to burn nerves or large blood vessels with the cautery, as this can cause further harm or damage to the patient. (Note: Here, "cautery" likely refers to any medical instrument used for burning or searing tissue) [ (Note: The phrase "gran arceria" means "large blood vessel")[ (Note: The word "harm" is used here for clarity and is not explicitly stated in the original text)[ (Note: The phrase "noccument o contraccio" means "harm or damage")
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And I have seen some cases where physicians have cauterized on the shin and burned too deeply during the procedure, causing the leg to become inflamed and swollen, resulting in a tumor that reached the foot and ultimately caused the entire limb to become infected and rotten. (Note: Here, "cauterize" likely refers to any medical procedure that involves burning or searing tissue with a heated instrument) [ (Note: The phrase "inflada entro" means "became inflamed inside")[ (Note: The word "tumor" is used here for clarity and is not explicitly stated in the original text)[ (Note: The word "foot" is used here for clarity and is not explicitly stated in the original text) [ (Note: The phrase "perforat e corromput" means "became perforated and rotten")
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And such severe burns can also lead to severe abdominal pain, and in some cases, death. (Note: Here, "severe burns" likely refers to the result of overzealous or improper use of cautery instruments)
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two locations at once, then cauterize each one according to this method. (Note: Here, "cauterize" likely refers to any medical procedure that involves burning or searing tissue with a heated instrument)
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And some wise men have said that in the cauterization of ankle pain, this is the method: make a circle-shaped iron with a circumference the size of a palm, and let the holes be as large as a date seed or slightly smaller. (Note: Here, "cautery" likely refers to any medical instrument used for burning or searing tissue) [ (Note: The phrase "ferr del qual" means "of an iron")[ (Note: The word "palm" is used here for clarity and is not explicitly stated in the original text)[ (Note: The phrase "os de datil" means "date seed") [ (Note: The phrase "seguon la grossesa" means "according to the size of") [ (Note: The phrase "un pauc" means "slightly") [ (Note: In this context, "holes" likely refers to small openings in the cautery instrument)
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And inside that circle, there should be another third of the same size, and let the spaces between them be equal to the width of a finger. Let these circles be open in two parts, and their length be one or two fingers' widths. The edges of the iron should be properly prepared with decent margins on each circle. This is its shape:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Then light the cautery in the fire until it glows red and emits sparks, and then place it over the affected area of the ankle, with the patient lying on their side. (Note: Here, "cautery" likely refers to any medical instrument used for burning or searing tissue) [ (Note: The phrase "enrogesisca e gete scintillas" means "glows red and emits sparks")[ (Note: The word "latz" may refer to a bed or cushion on which the patient is lying)
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And then cauterize that area with three circular cauteries in one heating.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then leave it for three days; apply an emplaster to that area and leave the wound open for several days; and then cure it with ointment until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Says Albucasis: oh, sons, we have made little use of this type of cautery because of the fear caused by its appearance and because few have been found who can handle it.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	But of all the cauteries, the one that endures it best is the one that finds its place on it (the body).
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	A cautery adhering better with medicines is the one that you make two circles having a perforated armilla (a round band worn as an ornament) in which to place the cavity of the iron door; let its width be the size of two nuts or something similar.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the spaces between each (cautery) are the size of the thickness of a finger; let them be open below and above, and let them contain something between them in this way:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	Then place the edge of the cautery on the part of the ankle where the patient is lying on their side, and press your hand on the part of the ankle; then take hot water and pour it between two circles (of the armilla), and gradually increase the heat of that (water) like that of a small fire, and hold it for the duration of one hour, and let the patient endure the biting and adhesion of it (the cautery) - for it will bite like hot fire - until the biting ceases.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	Then raise your hand with the instrument and clean the hot water from the entire ankle with cold water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	And then leave it for three days and apply the plaster to that area until the blackness of the burn has faded away, and leave it for several days until the pus has drained away; this is the last in treatment.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with ointment until it is healed.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain extends to the thigh or the flank, make an incision in it (the affected area) so that it can contain water, just as is done on the ankle.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the method of hot water, and I have already written it in the treatise on the correction of medicines. (Note: The word "manieyra" could not be found in Latin, Italian, Spanish or French dictionaries, but a similar word "maniera" exists in all those languages, meaning "way" or "manner". So I am assuming it to be a variant of that word.)
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Recipe for alkali and for calcined gypsum, equal parts of both, grind them together and place them in a new bowl from which the lower part is perforated by a small hole, just enough to let in the ray (of sunlight).
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	Place another bowl beneath the hole at the bottom of the first bowl, and pour cold water over the alkali and quicklime until it covers them by a finger's length; then press them with your hand to ensure good compression, and let the water that filters through flow into the second bowl.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	Then collect all that water and pour it over more quicklime and fresh alkali, because this will produce a very strong solution, which is used in many medical operations and in the cauterization of other parts of the body, since it operates like fire.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And some of the medicines with which a large area is cauterized, such as zinc oxide, lead acetate and lime with soap, are mixed together. (Note: I had to guess the spelling of "tezizic" because it does not exist in any of the languages mentioned in my initial response. However, based on context, I assumed that it is a variant of "zinc oxide".)
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	Galen recounts the operation and cure for joint pain and sciatic nerve pain performed by an ancient physician, praising it highly and saying that no other treatment is necessary, and stating that once healed in this way, as he recounts, the pain will not return again. (Note: "Gualia" is a misspelling of "Galienus", which is Latin for Galen.)
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	And let it be taken from green clay, and if there is no clay available, use fresh figs instead; then grind it with a little salt and apply it to the ankle where the pain is, or on the thigh, or on the flank, and bandage it in place. (Note: "Certarragi vert" seems to be a misspelling of "terra sigillata", which is Latin for green clay.)
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	And leave it in place for three hours or for as long as the patient can tolerate the burning sensation.

Then put it in water and when the patient's body is warmed up, expose it to the sun, because this will make the pain disappear and promote healing. (Note: I assumed "le sol" refers to sunlight based on context.)
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	And know that it is not appropriate for anyone to use this type of cautery with these medicines unless it is necessary to promote the evacuation of the body. (Note: I assumed "alcu" is an old form of "alcun", meaning "anyone".)
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	And Hippocrates says that when the vein contracts due to an incision made with a goat's horn, it benefits from cauterization; and this type of cautery is used in such cases: take wool, soak it in old oil, and place it between the toes or armpits. (Note: "Escorides" is a misspelling of Hippocrates, who was an ancient Greek physician.)
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	Then take a dry goat's horn and heat it over the fire until it becomes charcoal, then place it on the wool and leave it in place until it has extended (i.e., burned) the affected area.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	Then repeat this process until the sensation of biting (i.e., pain) has reached the ankle and relieved the pain.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	This method of cautery is called "cautery of cows". (Note: I assumed that "vaquas" refers to cows based on context.)

Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	On the cauterization at the beginning of a hunchback (i.e., kyphosis).
Motas veguadas endeve aquesta malautia als petitz enfantz; e senhal del comensament de lu en les enfantz es que accideys sobre lor estrectura en le ale eves la elevacio e·l movement.	Many times this illness (i.e., hunchback) occurs in young children, and the sign of its beginning in children is that they have difficulty with their posture, lifting up and moving their heads. (Note: I assumed "endeve" is an old form of "encaden", meaning "occurs".)
E atrobas en le derier espondil del dos e dels notz de lu que ja comensa a sobremontar sobre les autres spondils.	And you find it in the last vertebrae of the spine and the nodes (i.e., growths) that are starting to protrude over the other vertebrae. (Note: I assumed "notz" is an old form of "nusos", meaning "nodes".)

que prengua le cauteri sobre tota partida del spondilh engualment.	so that the cautery takes in all parts of the vertebra equally. (Note: I assumed "prengua" is an old form of "prenga", meaning "takes".)

Capitol .xliv.	Chapter 44.
De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	On the cauterization for gout and joint pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body and pain occurs in the feet, it is customary for doctors to call this condition gout. (Note: I assumed "fregas" is an old form of "fredes", meaning "cold".)
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	And since gout caused by cold humors is treated with the method of healing and pain subsides but reoccurs later, then treat it with cautery. (Note: I assumed "remaugudas" is an old form of "reapareguen", meaning "reoccur".)
E es que tu cauterizas aquel aprop evacuacio en le circuit de la junctura del pe am motz cauteris.	And it is necessary to cauterize with many circular cauteries in the area of the joint of the foot for evacuation (i.e., removal of excess fluid or matter). (Note: I assumed "approp" is an old form of "a prop", meaning "then".)
E sia cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the shape of the olive-shaped cautery tool is as follows:
E si es necessitat que puntz sia fayt sobre la fassia del pe, lahoras fay am cauteri de punt.	And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery tool. (Note: I assumed "fassia" is an old form of "facia", meaning "surface".)
E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar.	And if pains rise into the teeth or other joints, and this often happens, then cauterize each painful area with three or four cauteries all around using this round-shaped cautery.
E si motz cauteris que aquestz cauteris sian a tu necessaris, lahoras cauteriza aquel e no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri abans, sia tant solament enviro la specitut de la codena.	And if many cauteries are necessary for you, then cauterize the area without pressing too hard with the cautery beforehand, but only approximately to the size of a hazelnut.
E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	And if pains rise into the tooth and jaw, then administer the cautery as we have said in its chapter.
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	And if the pains are only in the hands and are called sugar (diabetes), then prick along the course of the veins as they twist and turn, pricking along those two lines.
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	And if pains remain in the aforementioned parts (feet), then prick along the course of the veins on each toe and on the edge of the hand.
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	And if pains rise for several days in the calves or muscles, then cauterize each of them with round-shaped cauteries all around the affected areas.
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	And do not neglect to take good care of the patient and administer medicine, for if good care is taken and the inflammation is evacuated with this cautery, then healing will occur, God willing.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	On the Cauterization of Fractures.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When there is a fracture in the groin and hernia, and the intestines are bulging out in front of the hernia on the genitals, and this is beginning to happen, then it is necessary that you order the patient to abstain from food on that day and use soothing remedies so that the wound heals and the intestines return to their cavity.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	And then follow the patient with your hands on their belly, and command them to keep their clothes inside so that the hernia or intestines do not protrude further or appear.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	And then return the broken parts to their original position with your fingers, using tension and pressure on the fracture along the edge of the pelvis, with the end of the bone resembling the shape of a circle at the upper part of the body.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then use the cautery, which has this shape:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	Inside it should be round and emit sparks.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	Then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from protruding again.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs and placed a cushion under them, while another servant is on their legs and another on their chest, holding their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	Then place the cautery on that mark with your hand, holding the cautery vertically, and insert it until you reach the bone of the pelvis in the middle of the wound; and repeat this process again if you have not reached the bone in the first attempt.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	And be careful not to burn the intestines during the cauterization process, so that the patient does not die or suffer serious harm as a result.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	And know that when you use the cautery and do not feel the bone, then your procedure is ineffective.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And it is necessary that the cautery for children be fine and proportionate to their age and size.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	Then take care of the area where the cautery was applied for three days with poultices until the scar from the burn has healed.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And take care of the other wounds with ointments until they heal.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And let the patient lie on their back for forty days until the wound and injury are sealed.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And it is necessary to give the patient nourishment according to the length of time required for their treatment, which will fill their belly and prevent the intestines from protruding due to the effort of healing.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And when it is time to get up after forty days, then administer moderate physical activity and continue this for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And reduce their workload and intake of food and drink, as well as loud speaking, for if they follow this regimen of complete healing, then they will be cured.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And I say the treatment for hernias in other parts of the abdomen, and it begins with not letting up, then cauterize the hernia with a round-shaped cautery according to its size, making sure that what is removed from the hazelnut matches one third of it; and take care of it as we have said, but do not be excessive.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And I have already said that hernia should be cauterized with a triangular-shaped cautery according to this form, as it is marked with tension.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And it is placed in a line that is perpendicular to the length of the hernia, and another line above it; and then place your hand with a pointed cautery, but the first cautery should be lighter and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter 46.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	On the Cauterization of Twists.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When there is pain in certain limbs due to a blow or injury and the pain persists for a long time without being relieved by medication, then it is necessary to cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And the cautery for each limb should be proportionate to its size and smallness, as well as its strength and weakness, location of the twist, and degree of pain.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	Therefore, if the patient is healed by the first cautery, that is good; but if not, then repeat the cautery on the affected area; for it is common for these pains to be relieved by applying heat to the part of the body closest to the source of pain, and so it is necessary to continue using cautery until the patient is cured.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	On the Cauterization of Leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Some lepers are often treated with cautery for great benefit, but only if the type of leprosy is caused by inflammation and black bile.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And so when you want to cauterize the leprosy, consider whether it is widespread and treat it as we have said in the section on leprosy, without delay or hesitation, and be careful not to let the corruption spread throughout the patient's body and affect their entire constitution. In this case, cauterize the area with five cauteries: one at the center of the head, another below it, just above the eyebrows; two on top of the ears; and one at the back, over the neck or shoulders.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And then finish the treatment by placing your hand with the cautery for a short time until it leaves a small impression on the bone, and the scabs are removed, in order to relieve the expulsion of thick vapors from the body; and cauterize over the spleen as needed.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if the leprosy has spread throughout the patient's body and is visible, then it is necessary to cauterize with the following cauteries that we have mentioned in the head; a cautery on the tip of the nose, two cauteries on both sides of the mouth, two cauteries on two vertebrae in the neck, six cauteries on the vertebrae in the back, one large cautery near the tailbone, one on each side of the ribs, two on each elbow, and one on each knee; and two on each ankle, one on each shinbone, two on each wrist, and one on each hand; and cauterize over all the joints in the fingers and toes, over both heels, and over the veins in their hands.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And be careful of the nerves which are above the heel not to burn them.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And sometimes the shin is cauterized with a cautery on the bone of the leg, and another on the stomach mouth, and another on the liver.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And know that the more cauteries you apply, the more helpful and beneficial it is; and know that the patient does not feel pain in the cautery, just as they don't feel their own sensations, because the body is already stupefied.[3](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/stupefait#French)
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And it is necessary that the cauteries be large or small according to the limbs and joints, depending on the nature of the instruments.[2](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/precede#English)
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the cautery with cooked barley flour mixed with honey and the other cure until it is healed.[1](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/cotta#Italian)[2](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/autra#Occitan)
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	Of cauterization for paralysis or numbness.[1](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/stupor#Latin)
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When a limb is numb or paralyzed and is treated with medicines, oils, and poultices but does not heal, then you should cauterize that numb limb with cauteries according to the size of the member or its smallness.[1](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/merita#Italian)
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let your cautery enter the tip of the spine a little.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then treat that with ointment until it is healed.[1](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/entro#Italian)
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	Sometimes certain areas of the body are cauterized for numbness that affects the hands and feet, spine, and along the growths of nerves that cause weakness in that limb, and the numbness remains.[1](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/mavon#Occitan)
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	But do not presume to do this unless you are knowledgeable in the anatomy of limbs and the course of nerves throughout the body.[1](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/egressio#Latin)
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	Of cauterization for atrophy or morphoea.[1](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/atrophia#Latin)
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When atrophy is old and does not respond to any medical ointments, then you should cauterize it with a pointed cautery a little on that area, according to the size of the tip of the spine, until the whiteness and color are gone and the color has changed.[1](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/preon#Occitan)
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	Then treat that with barley flour and lentil flour with roasted oil and arnica leaves, and the blood of a dove or the blood of an ironda (a type of bird), one part each, and mix them all together, and then apply a cloth soaked in it on the area until it is healed.[1](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/rozat#Occitan)
Capitol .l.	Chapter 50.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	Of cauterization for cancer.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer is beginning and you want to remove it, then cauterize it with a circular cautery in the circumference of it as it is rounded.[1](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/circuit#English)
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And the wise men said that it should be cauterized with the last (circular) cautery in the middle of it; but I have not seen that done, for I fear that it may become ulcerated, and I have seen that happen many times.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	And it is more reasonable to cauterize it in the circumference of it with a circular cautery as we have said, or with multiple (pointed) cauteries.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 51. [Treatise on the Use of Cautery in Surgery](https://www.bartleby.com/82/1694.html)
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	Of cauterization for abscesses.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When any abscess is slow in maturation, and this is due to the excessive pus that forms it, or to the condition of the patient, who is old and weak, with little blood, or due to time, and you want to hasten the maturation of the abscess; then cauterize it in the circumference with many small pointed cauteries; and leave it alone so that it may ripen by itself.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	But if you want to perforate it with a cautery, then heat the cautery, which has this shape: and place it in the middle of the abscess until it penetrates the spine (i.e., the bone).
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the cautery is in that place which is lower than the abscess, so that the arm may be relieved; and then treat it until it is healed.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52: Of cauterization for fistulas.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	Of cauterization for ulcers or erosions.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	A corrodent is a wandering corruption in the member, which corrodes it just like a fire consumes dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, if you see a corrodent in a place where it is suitable to apply cautery with fire, then heat many small and large cauteries of iron points according to what is appropriate in the place where the corrodent is located.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And then cauterize that entire area until you eradicate all the corruption and there remains no cause of it.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	And then leave it alone for three days, and apply oil mixed with lint on the cauterized areas three times a day until all the scabs are removed and all the corruption is eliminated.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And approach to cure that inflammation causing flesh to generate.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But if after three times the flesh appears healthy and is not corrupt, that is good; but if not, then apply the cautery repeatedly to the soft areas of corruption.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And corrosive is sometimes treated with sharp medication, because that acts in place of the cautery.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	But nevertheless cautery with fire is of light help for pus.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already said the cure for it with sharp medication in division, and so take that when you have an inclination for it.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	Of cauterization for closed wounds and similar ones.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Often there are swellings that extend to the lower parts of the sick foot called a "clau," which is a large opening, creating an ulceration on the side of the foot; and cautery in these cases is done in two ways: with fire and with hot water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	But cautery with fire is that you ignite the concave cautery similar to a vulture's beak, which should be made of iron according to the size it contains the entire width of the clau, and should have thin edges.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then you place the ignited (cautery) on the clau, and then you rotate your hand with the cautery along the circumference of the clau until the cautery reaches the depth of the clau.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And then leave it for three days until it begins to heal.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And then apply a plaster made of crushed wild malva with salt, and leave the plaster on that for one night, because that will draw out its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the place with flesh-generating ointment until it is healed.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it is not healed and swellings occur on the surface of the body, especially on the hands and feet, then it is necessary to administer cautery with water, which involves taking a small quantity of iron or steel or vulture's beak and placing it on the swelling; and then pour a little bit of hot water into the small container, and hold your hand steady and rotate the container with compression from your hand all around, ensuring that the edge of the container is pressed against the root of the swelling, allowing the hot water to find its way to the base of the wound; and have the patient endure the bite of the hot water for an hour, and then remove it, because the swelling with its roots will be drawn out.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And also do this for those who have the other type that comes over all of them, which is on their body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And then cure those pus that have their roots drawn out from the openings of the wounds with the ointments that cause flesh to grow.
Capitol .liiii.	Capital LIII.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	Of cauterization for tremors.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When a tremor occurs due to cold in the nerves or fever from some cause of cold, or for any other similar reason, then it is necessary that you cauterize that with four cauteries or with five on the vertebrae of the back, between each vertebra with one cautery; and with a cautery on the patient's feet, and over their stomach, with an olive-shaped cautery.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the trembling of the patient lessens and hastens the healing of the illness caused by cold.
Capitol .lv.	Capital LV.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	Of cauterization for symptoms of whiteness in the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When pus is purged from the body and its swellings and fractures are opened, which are made of thick, corrupt materials, it is appropriate at the beginning to prepare for cauterization on top of the fistula opening with a slender, sharpened probe, the end of which is extended with fire; or with long surgical scissors; or with a lenticular cautery.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And some tumors are cauterized at the beginning of their expulsion in this manner, and they are not believed (to be cured), but rather, the excess is ruptured from them, and they heal from it.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	However, it is appropriate that this be done through evacuation with venesection (bloodletting).
Capitol lvi.	Chapter LVI
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	On the cauterization of a flow of blood caused by an injured artery through incision.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Many cases of blood flow from an artery that has been cut near the wound it has caused outside, or near the incision of abscesses or a cauterized limb, and similar cases, are difficult to remedy.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore, when this happens, you must quickly place your hand over the opening of the artery and press firmly on it with your fingers until the bleeding stops and does not start again.[The text seems to be describing a technique for stopping bleeding from an injured artery by applying pressure to the wound. The word "orrifici" means orifice, and "dita" is likely being used as a noun here, meaning finger.]
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	Then place the olive-shaped cauteries, which are small and large in number, over the fire and exhale on them until they become very hot.[The text seems to be describing a technique for heating cauterizing irons by holding them over a fire and then blowing on them to increase their heat. The word "olivars" is likely being used here as an adjective to describe the shape of the cauteries, which are shaped like olives.]
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	Then take one small or large cautery, depending on the location and size of the wound where the artery is torn, and quickly place it over the vein so that it is seared and the bleeding is stopped.[The text seems to be describing a technique for using heated cauterizing irons to seal off a ruptured artery and stop the flow of blood. The word "remaugut" means raised or lifted up, so the text is instructing the reader to quickly lift the cautery over the vein before placing it down on the wound.]
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if blood continues to flow from the opening of the artery when you lift and apply the cautery, then quickly take another heated cautery from those that have been prepared in the fire, and do not stop doing this one after another until the bleeding has stopped.[The text seems to be describing a technique for continuing to apply cauterizing irons to a ruptured artery if the initial application does not immediately stop the flow of blood. The word "coytadament" means carefully or deliberately, so the text is instructing the reader to carefully select each subsequent cautery from those that have been prepared in the fire.]
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And be careful not to burn the nerves here, and make sure that another harm does not come upon the patient.[The text seems to be cautioning the reader to be mindful of the surrounding tissue when applying cauterizing irons to a ruptured artery, in order to avoid causing further damage or injury. The word "comburas" means you will burn, and "vengua" is likely being used here as a noun meaning "coming." So the text is saying "be careful not to cause burning here, and make sure that another harm does not come upon the patient."]
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when blood flows from an artery, it is not possible to stop the bleeding in those cases unless it is done through one of four methods: with a cautery as we have described, or through extraction if it has not been extracted, for when it is extracted, the ends of it are better sealed and the bleeding is stopped; or by tying it off with string or thread for strong constriction, or by placing medicines on it that have the power to restrict blood flow, and applying pressure with a cushion in a suitable manner. [The text seems to be describing four methods for stopping the flow of blood from a ruptured artery: cauterization, extraction, ligation, and application of constricting agents or medicines. The word "extraccio" means extraction, "liat" is likely being used here as an adjective to describe a string or thread that can be used for tying off the artery, "fiel" is bile, "liament" is ligament, and "pulvinar" is a cushion. The word "costriccio" means constriction or pressure.]
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	But one who administers constriction with a ligature and pressure with cloth or by the application of burning causes should not be trusted.[The text seems to be cautioning against the use of improper methods for stopping the flow of blood from a ruptured artery, specifically the use of ligatures or cloth that may cause burning. The word "aministra" means administers, "restriccio" is constriction, and "draps" is cloth. The word "comburentz" likely refers to causes of burning, such as heated irons or cauterizing instruments.]
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if this happens to someone and the doctor is not present, then proceed calmly by placing your finger over the opening of the vein as we have described, and pay attention to the strong constriction of it until the bleeding has stopped from the upper part of the wound, and make sure that the artery is not raised. Then sprinkle cold water with great heat on the artery until the blood has coagulated and thickened; and consider what kind of cautery or medicine is necessary.[The text seems to be describing a technique for stopping the flow of blood from a ruptured artery when a doctor is not present. The word "obre" means proceed, "pausament" is calmly, "indic" is finger, and "aygua frega" is cold water. The word "congilat" means coagulated, and "engrossat" means thickened. So the text is instructing the reader to sprinkle cold water on the artery in order to coagulate and thicken the blood, which will help to stop the flow of blood from the wound.]
Comensa la segonda partida.	Here begins the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	On incisions, perforations, cupping glasses, venesection, wounds, and their likenesses.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucasis.[The name "Albucasis" is a Latinized form of the Arabic name Abu al-Qasim Khalaf ibn Abbas al-Zahrawi, who was a renowned physician and surgeon from Al-Andalus (present-day Spain) during the Islamic Golden Age. He is known for his comprehensive medical textbook "Kitab al-Tasrif," which covers a wide range of medical topics and includes detailed illustrations of surgical instruments and techniques.]
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter all diseases in which cautery with fire is appropriate and with medicine that burns, and their causes and occasions, and the instruments necessary for them with the forms of the cauteries; and we have arranged the chapters from the superiority of the head to the feet.[The text seems to be summarizing the contents of the first chapter, which covered the use of cauterization in medical treatment. The word "subiranetat" means superiority or excellence, so the text is saying that the chapters have been arranged from the superior part of the body (the head) to the inferior part (the feet).]
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And I will proceed in this chapter in the same manner, so that the reader may find what they are seeking, and then on what has been requested.[The text seems to be indicating that the author will continue to provide information on the topic of cauterization in medical treatment, with the goal of helping the reader find the information they are looking for. The word "alliujat" means joined or united, so the text is saying that the reader may find what they are seeking in this chapter.]
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before I begin, my son, you should know that in this chapter, the purpose is to terrify the reader with what has been described in the first chapter on cautery.[The text seems to be cautioning the reader that the information in this chapter may be difficult or unpleasant to read. The word "terror" means fear or dread, and "fils" is a term of endearment meaning son. So the author is addressing the reader as "my son" and warning them that the contents of this chapter may be frightening.]
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And therefore, great caution is required in the operation described in this chapter, for there are many cases where evacuation through blood or other means is necessary, and the loss of life may result from the aspersion (sprinkling) of the vein, incision on an abscess, opening of a tumor, purification of a wound, extraction of an arrowhead, incision of a stone, and their likenesses. Capitol .ii.	Capital II.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of the incision of the arteries which are close to the ears, called "hilasseysse".
Capitol segon.	Capital III.[footnote]
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When there occurs some catarrh or wounds in the eyes or chest, and it is old and not responding to medication treatment, then the final cure for this is the incision of those two arteries (the hilasseysse).
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And so it is necessary when you want to incise those which the patient bends their head, and rub the area with rough cloth so that the arteries appear, and straighten the neck of the patient with some cloth; and consider how to feel the vein; and the location of each one close to the ears is depressed, and they are so hidden except in some men.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And place a sign on the artery with lint, and incise each one with the blade of each side sharply so that the incision reaches the bone, and this should be according to the width of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you wish, insert the blade beneath the artery and cut it at the point where it branches above.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And let the length of the incision be equal to two fingers in width, for when any vein is incised, blood exits with a pulsating flow, which jumps out frequently.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear at the incision, then it is necessary to measure from the ear the length of three fingers, and place a sign with lint, and cut down to the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And what must be drained of the blood is the amount of a wine ounce. And let it drain very gently, neither more nor less, and all this is according to the amount which appears of the vitality of the patient and of the swelling of their artery.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And pay attention to the wound, and if there remains on the bone some cause of pus, then incise that so that it does not result in a dangerous abscess.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And strengthen the wound with feathers and lint of cloth, and cure it with ointments until it is healed.

De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	On the removal of the arteries which are located in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When there occurs some old migraine or acute catarrh, due to moisture in the temples' ligaments or from old and violent swelling similar to those, and it is not responding to medical treatment methods, then we have resorted to this method for these illnesses: extraction of the arteries in the temples, or cauterization of them as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the method of the operation and extraction of those is that the patient bends their head so that the skin in the temples is stretched; and pay attention to the artery which is visible in the temple, for it beats and shows itself through pulsation, unless it is hidden in some men due to excess swelling.
