Capitol quart.	Capital IV.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	Of the care of bodily ailments from sharp and acrid tears of the eyes.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When it is sharp and acrid tears (coming) from the veins which are on top of the head, for which no cause of medical treatment confers a cure, and sometimes the face of the patient turns red and there is a sensation in the forehead like ants crawling, and the nails of those affected become thin, heated and their hair falls out, and the eyelids are scraped by the sharpness of the tears. The old remedies for the cure of these symptoms through this operation are named, and they call this cure with spasms.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And it is commanded that the patient should shave the hairs which are on their forehead and then make three incisions equally distant according to the length of the forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the incision is two fingers: let one incision be equally distant to the length of the nose in the middle of the forehead, and the second according to the length of a small finger's movement which are in the lacrimal, and the third on the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And beware of the incision near the arteries which are in two places, and keep your hand away from the continuation of both the jawbones.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And for each incision, adjust the space to be three fingers wide.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a sponge ready or dry cloths with which to dry the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And then insert the spatula with two sharp ends, of which this is the shape of the incision: [Here probably follows a diagram or illustration.]
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which extends from the temples to the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Scrape with that all the skin which is between two incisions with the convex part which is on the bone, and then do so from the middle of the first incision to the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then pull out this spatula and insert again another instrument in the first incision, called a scalpel, sharp on one side and not sharp on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And place the sharp edge of that against the attached flesh against the skin, and the blunt side down onto the bone, and insert it in such a way that it reaches the middle incision and with that cut all the veins which descend from the head to the feet.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	But continue the incision so that it extends from the skin, and then do the same with the middle incision to the other incision.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And when enough blood flows, press on the areas of the sponges soaked in coagulated blood.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then place in each incision a piece of old linen cloth and place on top of them powders mixed with wine and oil and vinegar, and see that pus does not develop and cause cautery to be necessary.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day, loosen the ligature and administer an abundant infusion of hot water or chamomile tea, and then cure it with basilicon ointment with rose oil and other things for healing wounds.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	Concerning the cure for tears (of the eyes) through catharsis and humors descending from the interior parts of the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When the catharsis is sharp and continuous, and sometimes the patient's nails become thin and small, and their appearance is weakened, and their eyelids are ulcerated and their hair has fallen out, and in the front of their head there is a sharp and biting pain with subsequent exhaustion, then one knows by these signs that the matter and catharsis do not come from large veins but rather from small veins proceeding from the interior parts.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure for this is as follows: order the patient to shave their forehead, and then make an incision in the middle of that area, one finger wide (starting from the left temple to the right temple) so that it reaches the bone; keep your hand away from the ligaments of the temples which are damaged due to chewing. The bone should be exposed through this incision.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry up all the blood with a sponge or dry cloth and then insert between the two lips of the incision old linen or bandages, filling it completely.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then strengthen above with powders mixed with wine and oil to prevent inflammation or suppuration from occurring.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you see that the abscess has diminished, it is necessary to rub the bone inside where the flesh begins to grow, and then cure it with a drying regimen which causes the flesh to disappear, as if you take two parts of wheat flour and four parts of colophony and mix it, and from it make a plaster and apply it to these fleshy wounds.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	About the treatment of what comes out of the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	The cause of all discharge from the ears falls into one of four categories: it is either mineral-like or similar to stone, such as iron and glass, or it comes from plants like cheese or beans, or it is watery like water and sour wine and their likes, or it comes from some animal.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And so when stone or any similar cause that does not belong or fit in the ear comes out of the ear, place the ear towards the sun and if you see the stone, then distill some violet oil or cedarwood oil on it, and then administer extraction, and make them sneeze with caution, and close their nostrils at the occurrence of a sneeze.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then place some wool or cloth wads in the ear canal, and pull the ear upwards to stretch the ear parts, because often these foreign bodies are pushed in with these causes (i.e., by cotton swabs).
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it (the foreign object) is not removed, then administer extraction of it with the instrument called the "gesti epicicarios" which has this form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	"And if it (the foreign object) is pushed in further with the instrument, that's good; otherwise, administer the extraction of it with a thin probe of double thickness."
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	"And therefore, if it is not pushed in further by that (the thin probe), then make a cannula from silver and insert the end of the cannula into the opening of the ear canal, and seal around the cannula with wax and softened oil so that only the cannula enters, but nothing else."
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	"Then extract with strong suction, because often as we have said."
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	"But if it is not pushed in further in this way, then take some alum-infused clay or a heated medical instrument with which the wings are pressed together in small amounts and place it at the end of the rod and then wrap it decently around the area."
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	"Then insert that into the opening of the ear canal with ease and then dry out the ear from any moisture."
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	"And therefore, if it is not removed by all the causes that we have mentioned, then you must consider cutting it out before it leads to an abscess or spasm."
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	"And the method for cutting it out is to first anesthetize the patient by tapping on the saphenous vein and extracting blood according to its virtue, then place your finger over the ear canal and turn the ear upwards. Then make a small incision in the cartilage of the ear, where you have pressed with your finger."
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	"And let the incision be crescent-shaped, reaching the stone, and once the stone is found, remove it with appropriate instruments if possible; then quickly close the incision and cure it until healed."
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	"And if the cause of the discharge in the ear is one of the waxes that are formed and swollen, then administer the cure and extraction for it; but if it does not obey your remedy, then take fresh soft sponge and shape it as follows:"
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	"And administer with this the abscess of that wax that has fallen into the ear."
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	"And do not do this if you think that it is already moistened by the vapor of the ear, and place it on many wads, and then extract it with thin probes or instruments as we have said, for the extraction will be made easier."
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	"But in the water that has entered the ear, it is necessary for the patient to use sneezing with caution at first, and fill the healthy ear with some old cotton and cover it with a cloth over the ear with water, and if it is removed by this, it's good; otherwise, take many thin pieces of wax and linen according to the length of your finger, heat them slightly in the fire, and the patient should insert one of those into the opening of their ear and jump on that foot on the same side and strike with a stone on the piece of wax inside the ear."
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	"And do not stop doing this with the stone until all the water is removed."
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	"And once the water is removed, you can take paper or cloth..." "And place one end of it (paper or cloth) in the ear and stretch out the other end with fire until most of it is burned."
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	"And place another cloth and do that many times until all the water is removed, and straighten it with a cannula as was said earlier about the stone extractor."
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	"But in the removal of an animal that enters the ear, if it is a small creature like a tick or something similar, cure it as we have said in the division; but if it is a large creature that causes pain and visible discomfort, then administer extraction with forceps and probes. And the cause of this is easier to deal with than any other cause that can affect the ear."
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	"But in the removal of a worm born in the ear, when you cure it with what we have said in the division and in the treatise on distillations and not confirm your treatment, then it is necessary to observe the ear in sunlight."
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And therefore, if any cause of the worm appears, then extract it with forceps or thin probes. But if no such cause is visible, then take a cannula that is narrow below and wide above, and this is its shape:"
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	"And insert the thin end of the cannula into the ear according to the amount that the patient can tolerate; then suck with it by strong suction and do this many times until all the worms are removed."
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	"But if it does not obey your remedy, then you should close and seal the opening of the cannula with wax as we have said; then administer distillations that have been proven by the ancients in the treatment of worms, and you will find this in the treatise on distillations."
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And your effusion should be with which you pour the medical oils into the ear using this instrument, the shape of which is as follows:"
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make one of silver or iron, narrow, with a small hole, and place it over it.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And so let it be like a plug that is in the cavity of the continuant canal here where it will be necessary.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you want, take the rod and wrap it appropriately at its end, then gently pour oil in the cavity of the ear, or juice of some herb, or any of these medicines into the funnel - which is in the ear canal -, and then carefully insert the wrapped rod with the cloth into the funnel and press it gently with your hand so that the oil is expelled slowly inside the ear canal and the patient will feel the oil going in.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what is inserted into the ear should be heated slightly with fire.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And make sure that the liquid you will instill in the ear is not too cold, because ear medications do not tolerate it.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of the treatment of blockage in the ear.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some infants get blocked ears because their Eustachian tubes are not yet perforated, and this can also happen to some adults due to blockage in the ear canal caused by wax or flesh that has grown inside it; sometimes this blockage occurs in the ear drum without the person realizing it, while other times it is located outside of the ear drum.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which occurs in the eardrum without causing noticeable symptoms is often associated with more difficult treatment and healing.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in the case where the blockage is noticeable, it is advisable to expose the patient's ear to sunlight and observe it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And so, if you see a visible blockage, open it with a thin spatula of the following form:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	The tip of the spatula should be narrow and have one side sharp while the other side is not, and it should be two finger widths wide to avoid damaging the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And so, if the blockage is caused by flesh grown in the ear or its canal, then use fine hooks and gently but firmly scrape it until all of the excess flesh is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the blockage is in the eardrum, then take a thin rod and heat it slightly with fire, then carefully insert it into the ear canal.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And if you have detected blockage because the patient is having difficulty hearing, then gently relieve the pressure with ease and be careful not to damage the ear's nerves.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then place on the ear a piece of cloth according to the size of the opening that you have wrapped with Egyptian ointment; do this for several days until you are sure of the healing of the wound, or take some and submerge it in water and pulverize it over it, repeat this three times a day and if you see that the ear has become inflamed, then it is necessary to lance it and replace it with another piece of cloth wrapped in wax made with rose oil until the swelling subsides; then heal it until it heals completely.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if there is bleeding, then soak a sponge or cloth in water and lay it on the ear and use the other treatment that stops the bleeding, which is called "distillation" in the treatise.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Of the treatment of blepharitis, which occurs in the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Blepharitis can occur in both eyes and it can be either due to excessive moisture or dryness.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, it is necessary to have tweezers or hooks and use a spatula with its edges to gently scrape off the crusts, then place this over the affected area three times a day.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if there is pain with bleeding, then you should use a fine lancet to cauterize the affected area.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best method of cauterization is to make several incisions and remove any remaining pieces of crusts, which can then be burned off with fire, preventing them from returning.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Of the treatment of styes that occur on the eyelids.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Styes are often caused by various factors that make them similar to chalazion in terms of hardness and durability, which is why they are also called "chalazion".
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And this is caused by an accumulation of thick moisture both inside and outside the eyelid.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the treatment for styes is to first determine if it is caused by an infection that has spread beyond the eyelid and affects other parts of the eye, in which case the cause is usually minor.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	And then make an incision along its length and gently scrape off the pus from all sides until it dries out, then use tweezers to remove the hardened crusts.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you are not prepared to make an incision, then gently insert the lancet into the eyelid little by little until it reaches the affected area; this should also work.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the wound is large, then use stitches to close it and heal it until it heals completely.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, then there will be no harm in leaving it alone since the pus will eventually dry up and heal on its own.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the stye is located on the inner surface of the eyelid and pointing towards its interior, then carefully lift the eyelid and use tweezers to gently pull it outwards before making an incision; if the eyelid is too thin or fragile, there's no need to make an incision.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And begin by washing the wound with salt water; and heal the area with that which fleshes itself once it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	On the treatment of a chancre on the upper eyelid.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	A chancre is an inflammation that occurs in the tissues of the upper eyelid, and it most commonly affects children. It makes their eyes sore and can lead to problems with their vision, as they are unable to look at bright light due to tears forming in their eyes.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And so you will often see these children constantly rubbing their eyes and sleeping with them closed. The eyelashes of their lower eyelids are damp, indicating that there is an inflammation covering the area, and it is apparent that a chancre is about to form on the eye. Additionally, if you press gently on the area with your fingers, you will feel that a chancre has already begun to form.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	One way to treat this condition is for the patient to place their head over a steaming pot of water and hot cloths are placed on them to induce sweating. A circle is then made around the affected area that is just large enough to contain arternach (a type of clay) from all sides, and this circle is placed over the affected area. The area is then pressed firmly with the fingers, causing the chancre to be pushed into the center of the circle. Then, a small incision is made in the center of the humidity with a sharp instrument, such as a scalpel, and the incision should not be any larger than the incision made during bloodletting (a medical procedure where blood is drawn from a vein).
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	However, in more severe cases, it is necessary to cut the entire abscess until you reach the arternach (clay), as in such cases, arternach is present in the depths of the wound and can be seen through a white-colored fissure.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Therefore, remove those cloths that you have wrapped around the area with your fingers and unroll them between your right and left hands until they are spread out.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And make sure that you do not touch the incision with your fingers when using the scalpel, so that you do not accidentally cut into the eye.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if you do not see the clay in the beginning of the incision, then continue to cut into the wound until you reach the clay, but make sure that you only cut a small amount at a time. After making the incision, remove the cloths as described earlier and soak some rags in a mixture of water and wine and place them over the affected area. Then, secure the rags in place with bandages.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And if there is any pus present, sprinkle salt on it and place it in the concavity of the incision so that it absorbs any remaining moisture from the wound.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And continue to treat the wound until it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if a boil forms in the area of the incision, then treat it with sedative plasters until it is healed.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	On methods for touching the eye.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When the eyelashes on the eyes become ingrown due to natural growth and are old, this can lead to various ailments such as constant tearing and swelling of the eyelids, which can ultimately result in destruction of the eye known as tactinir of the eye. There are four ways to treat this condition: using cautery with fire; using sharp medicine as previously described in the chapter on cautery; performing atactini (a type of surgical procedure) by making an incision and stitching it up; or using cannulas (small tubes used to drain fluids from the body).
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And so it is necessary for you to position the patient's head towards your lap; then, use your left hand to turn the eyelid of the affected eye upwards. If you are able to do this, then proceed with the treatment. However, if you cannot turn the eyelid upwards, insert a needle into the part of the eyelid that is closest to the pus-filled area, and push the needle through the fleshy part of the eyelid so that it comes out just above the edge of the eyelid, near where the eyelashes grow. Then, use the needle to pull the pus out of the eyelid, and turn the eyelid upwards using your hand.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	Then make an incision in the inner part of the lower eyelid, just below the ingrown lashes, using a sharp instrument such as a scalpel or lancet. After making the incision, remove the pus and place small pieces of cotton or cloth underneath the eyelid. Then, apply a bandage over the eyelid with a shape similar to that of a myrtle leaf.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	However, it is important that the shape of the bandage corresponds to the degree of swelling of the eyelid, as this can vary from person to person. In some cases, a large portion of the upper eyelid may need to be incised in order to accommodate for the degree of swelling.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	Then make an incision with the scalpel along the two lines that you have marked, starting from the larger tear duct and moving towards the smaller one.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your incision is near the natural lashes, make it as thick as a royal coin (presumably referring to a large, heavy coin).
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	Then place a small piece of linen in one of the corners of the wound and remove all of the excess skin from around it. Next, use fine wool or thread to stitch together the two sides of the incision, and clean away any blood that may have accumulated. If you wish, you can use some sticky substances to attach any excess pieces of flesh to the eyebrows. However, this is not necessary.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	And then leave the stitches in place for three or four days, and then remove them.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you wish, you can leave the wound unstitched and treat it with drying and constricting agents, as the eyelid will become swollen due to the sealing of the wound and its healing process. However, it is generally better to use stitches. This is what the ancients would have done.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	However, if the patient is concerned about the wound, it is best to address their concerns and proceed with caution, rather than causing them unnecessary fear or distress.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	Another method for treating the wound is to place a myrtle leaf-shaped bandage over the eyelid and use three separate and connected hooks to lift the eyelid in the following manner:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	However, if that is not possible, use hooks and make sure they are clean. If they are not clean, take a needle with thread and insert it into the center of the bandage shape. Then, place one end of the thread near the larger tear duct and the other end near the smaller tear duct, and adjust the placement of the threads evenly between your fingers. Finally, use your hand to lift the entire eyelid, along with the bandage, as previously described.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then stitch together the two sides of the wound and treat it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	However, if a boil forms near your incision or wound, treat it with a salve and similar substances, as well as with ointment.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And sometimes the eyelashes may become ingrown, in which case it is necessary to use the method that I described earlier for making an incision. However, stitching is more artificial and should be used in some cases.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	Treating tactinir with cannulas is done in the following manner:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	The first step is to turn the eyelid and make an incision along the inner edge, as I have previously described. Then, create two thin cannulas or rods that are the same length as the eyelid and narrower in width than the scalpel.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already made incisions at the ends of each section where the threads are located.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	Then carefully attach each section to the excess skin of the eyelid with delicacy, and tightly bind the cannulas of each section with strong force, leaving them in place for several days. The eyelid will die and become necrotic due to the tight binding, and it will eventually fall out on its own.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	If it is delayed, then lance the abscess with a knife, and immediately cure the wound until it is healed.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	Therefore, when the eyelid is swollen, it is raised and the lashes do not prick (meaning the swelling has gone down).
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the way to make two tubes, which you will make according to this form.
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	and it should be of the same length and width, neither more nor less.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	Of lifting prickly hairs on the eye with a needle when the hair is hard (tough).
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When the hairs are unnatural, hard, rough and prickly on the eye, then the operation in it is that you take a fine needle and place its tip in a fine cedar wood or lion's claw, and make sure to adjust the ends of it very delicately, with each end having a small knob.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And let the length of the fields be of the quantity of one palm. (Palm refers to the width of the hand)
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	Then you make another fine needle below it in a short time, and use its ends if you wish.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	Then place the patient's head in your lap, and do it near the sunlight so that your work is clear, for this is a delicate and fine operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	Then insert the needle in the root of the hair with precision, which requires skill, and make it penetrate into the eyelid quickly until you extract the one below the natural hair.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	Then pull the hair out above and insert the needle into the incision, and let there be one or two or three hairs, not more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	Then pull your hand with it until the hair is extracted with the incision in the eyelid along with the natural hair.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if it is pulled with the incision and the hair is not extracted, then pull the incision towards the bottom with the needle that you have made until the incision of the upper tear is extracted.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And you will know this with the vision of the eye, for then you will extract the incision and needle, and the wound will be healed, and leave it closed for two or three days until the hair adheres to its place and new flesh grows over it.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if the hair is shorter than the natural hairs, then you adjust a long hair to match the natural hairs and raise it with that or let it stay until it grows longer over some space, and then you raise it.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	Of the treatment of hematoma that appears on the upper eyelid.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When hematoma appears on the eye and there is contraction of the eyelid when it contracts upwards, or to the right or left side due to poor healing of wounds or incisions or cauterization, and it is called leporina, and this hematoma can be natural or accidental, made by healing of wounds or incisions or cauterizations or similar causes. [https://medical-dictionary.thefreedictionary.com/leporine](https://medical-dictionary.thefreedictionary.com/leporine)
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	The method of the operation for this is that you break up the scar tissue and separate its lips, place a piece of linen cloth in it where there is space between them, and bind those together until they are healed.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And it is not appropriate to use treatment for this condition that dries or constricts, because if you do so, it can cause a return of hematoma even worse than before.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use for this a treatment that softens such as fenugreek, and soak it in water with crushed leaves and seeds of it or any similar herb, which is liquefied with one of the oils, and submerge the cloth in it and cure with it. Fenugreek has anti-inflammatory properties that may help reduce swelling.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	The key to your treatment is that you carefully perforate and break up the scar tissue that has not healed properly, as was done at the beginning of treatment.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation that we have mentioned is only a correction of hematoma, which does not return the form of the area as it was before. This means that while the treatment may be effective in reducing the hematoma, it will not restore the eyelid to its previous appearance completely.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	Of the treatment of hematoma that occurs on the lower eyelid. [https://medical-dictionary.thefreedictionary.com/Hematoma](https://medical-dictionary.thefreedictionary.com/Hematoma) The term "ehacrati" is not a medical term, but it seems to be referring to hematoma in this context. Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This hematoma that occurs on the lower eyelid, which is truly called hematoma, can be either natural or accidental in origin. The term "vertadierament" means "truly" in old French and it emphasizes that "alxacrati" (hematoma) is its correct name.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	But an accidental hematoma is caused by wounds, incisions, cauterization or other similar causes. This means that it's not a natural occurrence but rather caused by external factors such as injury or surgical procedure.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	The method of operating on this type of hematoma is to take a needle with double thread and insert it into the flesh. Then, pass it from the lacrimal (tear duct) of the left side to the lacrimal of the right side, until the thread reaches both ends of the flesh. The term "lacrimal" refers to the tear duct in medical language.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	Then pull the skin apart with the needle and stitch it up with the needle, and make an incision wide enough using a spatula. The term "spatum" refers to a surgical instrument that was used for making incisions or separating tissues.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And so if the shape of the eyelid returns to its proper form, that is good; and if not, take a scalpel and place it in the split shape, then use the scalpel to adjust the shape of the lower eyelid, creating two incisions on the edge of the lower eyelid. The term "latz" means "edge" or "margin" in old French.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And let the ends of the two incisions be at the two angles of the cut that you made, where they meet, and make sure that the angle formed when they come together is even and creates a proper shape for them. The term "concurren" means "come together" in old French. The text describes making two incisions on the edge of the lower eyelid, and then adjusting the shape by ensuring the angles formed are even and symmetrical. This step helps to ensure that the eyelid heals properly and maintains its proper shape.
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this figure is the Greek letter lambda (λ). The incisions made on the edge of the lower eyelid are in the shape of the Greek letter lambda, which looks like an upside-down "V". This technique was used to adjust the shape and position of the eyelid.
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	Then remove the skin from it by an amount equal to the edge of it below, so that the eyelid is dried. The term "osta" means "remove". This step is used to remove excess skin and adjust the position of the lower eyelid to ensure proper closure and prevent dryness. The text specifies that the amount of skin removed should be equal to the edge of the eyelid below, ensuring a symmetrical and proportional correction.
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	Then bring together the separated parts and stitch them with wool thread, and treat those areas with the softening medicines and dressings until they heal. This step is important to ensure proper healing of the incisions made on the lower eyelid and prevent any complications such as infection or scarring. The use of softening medicines and dressings will help reduce inflammation, promote healing and improve the cosmetic appearance of the eyelid.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	If the hematoma forms due to a cut or stitch or cauterization, then it is necessary to make an incision with a flat cut over the hairs of the eyelid as previously described. This step helps to release any accumulated blood or fluid under the skin and promote healing by allowing new tissue to form in the affected area. The text emphasizes that this technique should be used when hematoma is caused by cuts, stitches or cauterization.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	Then separate with dressing between two lips as we have said. This means that after making the incision and removing any excess tissue, the wound should be packed with dressings to help absorb any fluid or blood and promote healing. The text emphasizes the importance of separating the edges of the wound with dressings, which helps to ensure proper healing and reduces the risk of scarring. This is similar to modern-day wound care practices where wounds are often packed with medicated gauze or other types of dressing material.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In summary, the treatment for hematoma, whether it is above or below the eyelid, should be done with care and in a way that matches the form of the hematoma, which can vary in many ways. This means that each case of hematoma must be treated individually, taking into account its specific shape, size, location and underlying cause. The text emphasizes the importance of careful assessment and planning in the treatment of hematoma to ensure optimal outcomes and minimize the risk of complications.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And wise practitioners always prepare in every possible way the necessary skill and techniques to restore the shape of the affected area as close to its natural form or as near as possible, depending on what is appropriate for each patient's condition during the operation and with the use of various instruments. This means that medical professionals must be skilled, knowledgeable and adaptable in order to provide effective care and achieve optimal outcomes for their patients. They should be prepared to use a variety of techniques and tools in order to address the unique needs and challenges presented by each case of hematoma or other medical condition.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	Chapter 15: On the Adhesion of the Eyelid to the Conjunctiva or Cornea
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When this consolidation occurs in many men, such that the eyelid is adhered above with the white part of the eye, and it is prevented from moving freely or performing its natural functions, then it is necessary to insert the blade of a scalpel under the eyelid, and raise it up or stretch it using forceps. This procedure aims to separate the adhered parts and allow for normal movement and functioning of the eyelid and eye. It requires skill and care to avoid causing further injury or damage to the delicate tissues involved. The text emphasizes that this is a necessary step in treating this condition, as it can significantly impact vision and quality of life if left untreated.

Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De reduccio de arizati al nas.	About reducing fractures in the nose.
Quan tu curas arisati am cauteri o am medicina aguda comburent segon que es precedida la narracio de lu e no es sanat, lahoras no es engen en lu sino que fendas sobre le apostema deves la maturitat de lu, e que extraguas tota la humiditat la qual es en lu e·l poyre entro que sia descubert le os.	When you treat fractures with cautery or burning medicine, as preceded in its narration, and it is not healed, then do not bandage it but instead cut open the abscess until it matures, and extract all the moisture that is in it and the pus until the bone is exposed.

Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	About reducing the prominence of the wound.
Quan le huel emineys am la sua totalitat e no accideys en le vezement nocument ni diminuacio, lahoras cove que laxas le malaute, e aprop que·l segues, e aprop que pausas ventozas en le cervitz ses scarificacio e succa per bona succaccio; e aprop pausa sobre le huel liniment le qual sia fayt de acatra e aloe e enses e sarcocolla, e aprop strenh le emplaustre sobre le huel am motz polvils. De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	On the treatment of flesh that is decayed in the nose (The author is introducing a new topic on treating tissue damage or infection in the nose)
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat. And since that has been done, draw the scent towards the nostrils so that it reaches the nasal passages and is expelled over the patient's face, because many children in school do this action and it is an easy task for those who want to do it.

E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And finally, at the end of the treatment, place a lead cannula in the nose for several days until it has healed.

E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas. E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And these nasal cleansing instruments are valuable: recipe for a mixture of beaver castoreum, white balm, ginger, saffron pilgrim, long pepper, asafetida, and spikenard each one unit. De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	Of teething in the extremities of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu. But if the incision is delayed until it becomes enlarged, then consider whether it has become stone-like, hard, with a dark color and little sensation; in this case, do not touch it with iron because it is a malignant abscess, as many have found great misfortune from attempting to incise this type of abscess.

And if the abscess is of a soft touch and not dark colored, and incision is possible in all cases, then evacuate the patient and make the incision without fear, and cure the area with drying and constricting substances until it heals.

De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Chapter 28: On incising attached flesh in the gums.

Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	On the extraction of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	It is necessary that you treat the tooth for its pain with all care and take your time in its entire extraction, because there is no cause that can replace the loss of it once extracted, because it is a subtle substance that is concealed within, which makes up for the loss during the extraction.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	But when the patient is forced to have that tooth extracted, you must be absolutely certain which tooth is causing the pain, because often the pain deceives the patient and they think it's in a healthy tooth, and so you extract the wrong one and the pain doesn't stop until the truly diseased and painful tooth is extracted. This we have seen through the practice of barbers.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore, how can you be sure which is the painful tooth, and when you know that, it is necessary to make an incision in the gum around the tooth with a scalpel that has some virtue (sharpness), until it is loosened from the gum all around, then use those tools mentioned earlier (i.e. forceps or delicate tweezers) gently and gradually until you extract it.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And apply strong forceps or large tongs for good leverage or firm hold, and place the patient's head between your knees so that you have a firm grip and control, then pull the tooth gently along its axis in a straight line, making sure not to break it or cause the patient further pain.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And so if it is not loose enough, then take one of those instruments and insert it beneath it from all sides with ease and apply gentle pressure to loosen it, just as you did at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is fractured or decayed, then it is necessary to pack a piece of cloth around the break and secure it with a thin thread so that it does not break further during your manipulation with forceps.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And it is necessary to operate carefully by making incisions in the gum around the entire tooth and be cautious not to break it off completely, but rather leave a portion attached, then return your attention to the patient because often the initial pain of the procedure is less than the subsequent pain that may follow.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And be careful not to do what some ignorant barbers do in their haste and boldness during extractions without following our recommendations, because they often cause greater injuries and ailments that are more difficult to heal, and even extract additional teeth or bones from the jaw, as we have often witnessed.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And after the extraction, rinse the patient's mouth with wine (or vinegar) mixed with salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if there is bleeding after the procedure, as often occurs, then apply some powdered cinnamon and sprinkle it over the wound, and if that does not stop the bleeding, cauterize it.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The shape of the forceps and delicate tongs used to extract the tooth at the beginning should have a long handle, short grip, and be thick, so that they are not easily bent or deformed when in use.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And similarly, the forceps with a large grip should be strong enough that they are not easily bent or deformed when using them, and have short handles.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And they should be made of iron from India, with straight handles and teeth at the ends that fit together to exert a strong force when squeezed, some have a shape like the beak of a bird called a stork (or crane), which provides a strong grip when used for extraction. De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	On the care of prominent or protruding teeth.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth are prominent or protruding beyond their natural shape, particularly in women and especially in young girls, it is necessary to consider the following: if the tooth does not overlap any other tooth and cannot be removed by cutting or filing, then root out that tooth with this instrument, which has a sharp point like a pig's snout and is made of iron from India.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz. This may take several days due to the hardness of the tooth, and it is important to avoid damaging surrounding teeth in the process.

And the file should be made entirely of iron, with many small points like those on a needle-making awl, which can be used to gently and gradually file down the tooth over several days with ease, avoiding damage to other teeth or gums. This technique requires patience and precision, as it is important to remove only the excess material and not harm the surrounding tissues. The use of iron tools from India, valued for their strength and sharpness, ensures that the file will be effective in removing the unwanted protrusion while minimizing the risk of injury.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And finally, smooth the tooth with these rasps, and then use these razors to remove any remaining excess material.

Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	On the restoration of damaged teeth with gold or silver alloy fillings.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When teeth are damaged by trauma, such as from impact or injury, and cannot be treated with medicinal remedies, it is necessary to use strong materials like gold alloys for repair. Gold alloys are preferred over silver alloys because they do not corrode or discolor over time. Silver alloys can tarnish and turn black, causing further damage to the tooth and surrounding gum tissue. Therefore, it is recommended to use gold alloys for dental fillings and repairs whenever possible, especially in cases where long-term durability and stability are important.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And the filling should be of such fineness and thickness as can fit between the teeth; and the shape of the filling is to take the gold alloy and place twice as much as necessary between two healthy teeth, then curve or bend the alloy between two damaged teeth, whether it's one or several, until the filling reaches the healthy tooth on the other side.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And apply the bandage again to the part from which you started, and strengthen your hand with ease and wisdom so that it is not poorly done.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And your bandage, with which you strengthen the liver, should cover the roots of the teeth so that it does not escape.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And then cut off the excess parts of the liver with forceps or scissors, and place them in each location with care, and turn them and hide them between the healthy tooth and the damaged tooth, so that it does not cause injury to the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And then leave it as tight as Roman (garments).
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it becomes loose or torn, strengthen it with another liver in such a way throughout its duration.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of teeth and the figure of the arrangement of two healthy teeth and two damaged teeth, as you sometimes see them arranged like this:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when it is done so that one or two teeth return to their sockets in their places, and they have grown back as we have recommended, and they are painful.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And only a skilled and wise person should do this.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And sometimes a cavity is filled with some pieces of cow bones, shaped like teeth, and placed in the place where the tooth is missing, and secured as we have said, and it remains and serves for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Of the incision of the ligament that is found in the tongue and prevents speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament that is found below the tongue may be congenital or natural, present at birth, or it may develop as an accident and result from an injury that has already healed.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	The operation consists of opening the patient's mouth with your head positioned at their feet; then raising their tongue and carefully cutting the ligament nerve according to its width, until the tongue is released from its attachment.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if there is any hardness or thickening due to scarring from an old injury, then you should inject a probe and cut through the thickness until you have completely severed the ligament and released the constriction.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And take care not to make a cut in the skin of the tongue, and that you cut only the ligament and avoid cutting any blood vessels, causing bleeding.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	Then rinse the wound from the incision with water or vinegar or warm water, and then place a soft ligament under the tongue; that is, a small piece of leather or cloth, to keep the patient's tongue from returning to its previous position so it does not become attached again.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	But if there is bleeding, place a piece of vitriol trissat (a type of mineral) on the wound, and if the bleeding persists, cauterize the area with a red-hot iron called lantigo that is suitable for this purpose.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the wound with other remedies until it heals completely.
