"And what distinguishes a penetrating fistula from a non-penetrating one is that you insert your finger into the anus and carefully introduce a thin piece of glass or metal into the fistula where there is no tortuousity."
Mays si en aquela es turtuositat, lahoras entromet en aquela tenta subtil de plom o de pels de caval entro que tu sentas la tenta o le pel en le tieu dit.	But if there is tortuousity in that area, then carefully insert a thin probe made of lead or horsehair until you feel it with your finger.
E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	And if you do not feel it (the probe) at all or cannot proceed with the passage due to any cause of evacuation, such as stool, worms, or flatulence, as we have mentioned, then know that it is non-penetrating, and so turn your attention to its treatment.
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	And when the fistula penetrates into the bladder or into the flesh of the penis, then its significance is the discharge of urine from it and the prevention of that until the place with medicine is healed.
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	But if it is penetrating into the joint of the thigh or into the bone and causes pain in the area around it, then its symptom is that when you insert a probe into it, if there is no tortuousity within the bone, there will be pain in the area around it; and pus will always come out of it; and no medicine will work on it, nor can it be healed with ointment.
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	And in all cases of penetrating fistulas, there is no complete cure, and the treatment for them is hard work and futility on the part of the foolish doctors who attempt it.
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	But in those that are not penetrating and not old, healing with iron is expected, according to what I have recommended and proven.
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	And the patient should lie on their back with their hands under their head and raise their legs in the air, with their buttocks inclined towards their stomach, and then insert a probe made of lead or glass if there is twisting in the fistula until you can determine where the probe goes.
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	And if you feel the patient around the anus, then you must insert your finger into the anus.
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you feel in your finger the probe already inserted and discovered penetrating, or something else between your finger and the fistula or flesh, then you know for certain that it is penetrating; and so do not work on it, because it cannot be healed, as we have said.
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	However, some people say that it is healed in some old men.
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	And the medication by which healing is expected in it (the fistula) is that you light a fine cautery according to the width of the fistula, as has been described before, and insert the burning cautery into the fistula until it reaches around the anus; and then repeat this two or three times until you know that all the diseased flesh around the fistula has been burned away, similar to a bird's feather quill.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	And then cure it with hot compresses wrapped in a cloth until all the burned flesh has healed, and then cure it with medicines that promote tissue growth and consolidation. If it is healed, that's good; but if not, then it will never be healed by any other treatment.
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	And if the probe enters but does not penetrate inside your finger which is in the anus, and between that and the probe there is a thin layer of flesh or membrane, and sometimes the fistula appears on the surface of the skin, then dry out the skin starting from the beginning of the fistula with the probe. Dry it out using the probe until the drying reaches the location where the end of the probe is in the fistula, and then use the probe to release and remove the blockage in the fistula.
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	And then clean the fistulated flesh which is similar to a feather quill of a bird and leave no residue of any cause.
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	But if blood flows instead of pus when you insert the instrument and perform the operation on those tissues, then you must burn it with a hot iron or an acute medicine because cauterization with fire has two good effects: namely, the burning of those diseased tissues and the cutting off of the blood flow by drying up the moisture.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	And then cure it with hot compresses wrapped in a cloth or a piece of linen until the wound is healed, and then cure the wound with hard-skin-generating and consolidating ointments.
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	And such medicines, which have astringent and drying properties; when they are used, the injury is restored and healed, and there is no fear of recurrence.
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	But if the fistula has already penetrated deep into the rectum of the anus and is extending from the surface of the body, then insert your finger into the anus and examine it with that.
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	And therefore, if you find the opening and between you and it is an obstacle of pus or flesh, and it is close to penetration, then it should not be operated on but rather treated with trust and hope.
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	This condition can be treated in one of three ways: by cauterizing the opening as we have said; or by drying it out until you are able to reach the cavity, so that you can introduce the necessary treatment; and do not dry it out too much, so as not to damage the muscle that holds in the intestines, and cause involuntary discharge from the patient; and heal it with what we have said, for it will easily be healed. Or by removing the obstacle and cleaning out the pus that has formed within, as we have said, either with your finger or with another sharp instrument, and then clean the fistulous flesh in the area where you can make an incision; and then try to heal the entire wound with an incision, and if the opening of the wound does not close, and the fistula remains open at the end of the anus, it will be easier for the patient.
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes the fistula ends in this way: when you insert your finger into the fistula, it is located near the surface of the body around the edge of the anus, and then take hold of a blunt extremity, similar to a needle for preparing hearts in this form:
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	and insert it into the sheath of pus or around it, and then insert your finger coated with pus into the fistula until you reach its cavity.
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	But if it has penetrated near the edge of the anus, then remove the sheath from the opening, and insert your finger into the anus, and extract the end of the sheath and align both ends, pulling on each one, leaving it in place for a day or two. And when you reinsert the sheath into the flesh, pull it tightly so that the flesh between the two ends of the sheath is cut and falls away.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	And then heal the wound until it is consolidated and healed.
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	But if the opening of the fistula is not deep enough, then make it deeper using any means available to you, but not so much that you damage the muscle; and then heal it until it is healed.
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	The shape of a pointed spatula, with which the fistula is opened: its curvature is very sharp and the other end is not sharp, so that you do not damage anything unnecessarily, as sometimes happens.
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	Regarding the suture of hemorrhoids where blood is flowing from their incision.
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	Hemorrhoids are of two types: either they are inside the anus like charcoal, or they resemble lumps of fat.
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	And they can be small or large, and blood flows from them continuously, and they are one or many, and they protrude from the anus, and at their extremities.
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	But those that protrude from the anus are of low moisture content, from which clear water or a small amount of blood with continuous flow, and they are of the same color as the body.
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	And the treatment for those that are inside the anus is to instruct the patient to sit and apply pressure until the anus protrudes and the hemorrhoids become visible to you.
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then you should prepare yourself and hold on to the patient's cheeks with your fingers or with your nails, and then cut the hemorrhoids along their edges.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	But if the hemorrhoids are too moist and soft for you to hold on to with your fingers, then take a rough cloth or a piece of leather or a woolen cloth, and pull them out with your fingers, and then cut them along their edges and sprinkle some powdered cautery over the wound, so that they will heal without the need for cauterization; or cauterize them as described in the chapter on cauterization.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And then heal those with the same treatment until they are healed.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	But if the anus does not respond to pressure, then use a suppository with a small bite on it, and wash it with water that is in the anus, so that it will easily come out when the patient applies pressure.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	But if the hemorrhoids are outside the anus, then the cause is simple: you can either take hold of them with your nails or use forceps to cut them, and then heal them as we have said until they are healed.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	And if there is an incision, it is necessary to suture the hemorrhoids in this way: take a sheath of pus and insert it into a needle, then pull the hemorrhoids up to their bases and insert the needle into the edge of the other part, and wrap the ends of the sheath around the lower part of the needle, laterally; and tighten the hemorrhoid with strong tension, and then remove the needle.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	Do this to all of them, but leave one open and do not close it, so that the excess blood can flow from it.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	And then place a cloth soaked in rose oil or wax on the anus, and place it over the anus and instruct the patient to rest.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then leave it in place until it falls out by itself, and when it has fallen out, heal the wound with ointment or other treatment until it is healed.
De curacio de fistulas.	Regarding the treatment of fistulas. [Continued in next part...]
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Many times, fistulas occur as a result of dryness from wounds or constriction of nature.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And when they are old and not responsive to treatment, then it is necessary to open them with the point of a spatula or your nail until they become moist and the dry scab on top falls off, which prevents healing; and then heal them until they are consolidated.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Then you should open them with a sharp instrument until they bleed and are scraped clean, and then heal them until they are healed.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	Regarding the treatment of abscesses, it is a nail.
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	Know that an abscess is called a "nail" because it resembles a round knob the color of the skin, and it can appear anywhere on the body but is most common in the lower parts of the legs and feet, and its treatment involves lancing it to release the pus.
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	And so it is necessary to make an incision in the circumference of the "nail" and drain it with forceps or clamps, and then remove it from its root; and then heal the wound.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if you wish, you can cauterize the wound as described in its chapter.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	A wart is a small, rough, round, fistulous protuberance on the surface of the skin, and many times they occur in children's hands.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	The treatment for warts is to cut or scrape them open with a sharp instrument, or to remove them by tying a string around the base and leaving it until the wart falls off.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if you wish, you can cauterize it with heat or an acidic substance, as we have said.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And they can be removed, whether inverted or not, using the instrument that I mentioned earlier. (Note: It is unclear from the text what specific instrument the author is referring to.)
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	A "formica" (which means ant in Latin) is a small, swollen or fistulous lump on the surface of the body that extends into the flesh and causes a stinging sensation when touched, similar to a bite from an ant. It can be found anywhere on the body but is particularly common on the head and face.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	The treatment for a "formica" is to take a quill from a goose or a vulture, and make it strong, then place it over the ant until it contains the circumference of the ant; and then rotate your hand with the quill inside until you cut into what is in the circuit of the ant, and place it deep in the flesh, and then remove the ant from its root.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you want, do this with an eram (brass) or iron cannula in the following way:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	The upper part of the cannula should be fine and blunt (not piercing), wrapped in such a way that the impression on the finger is dulled and the rotation of it is smooth.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if you wish, you can cauterize the ant as described in the section on cauterizing abscesses in the chapter on cautery.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	Here are some of the forms that medical instruments used for administering enemas can take:
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Sometimes, an enema is administered using a vessel made of silver, lead, or brass that has been melted or hammered into shape. The size and shape of the instrument used will depend on the patient's needs, with smaller instruments used for children and those with weak or sore bottoms. Small enema vessels are also recommended for patients who experience pain during the procedure.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	Here is the form of a large enema vessel (or "cristeri"):
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The top of the cannula where the bag is attached should be wide and have a distinct marking indicating where the bag should be attached, as described here:
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the lower end of it, which is inserted into the anus, should be blunt (that is, not sharp) and tapering towards the end; and on one side of it there should be two holes, and on the other side one hole, and the width of the holes should correspond to the thickness of the rays, and slightly larger.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And let the bag be where the medications of animal bladder or sheep wool are placed, and its size be one palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And let it be pierced with many holes as it is rolled up; and the size of the space between the holes should be the thickness of a finger.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	Then insert into those holes strong gall bladder extract, of which there should be ten or so; and attach it to the bag; and when the bag is placed on the affected area, make sure it is tightly fastened at the top of the patient's head between two distinguishing marks with a strong constriction, and tie each hole with it. The quality of tying it is that you fill the bag with medicine, which should be warmed according to the patient's tolerance; and make sure it is not too hot or too cold.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	Then let the patient be placed on their back, and lift their legs and place a cushion or pillow under them. Then apply oil, egg white, or fenugreek mucilage to the exterior of the cautery tool, and gently insert it into the anus with ease. Then have the assistant take the bag and squeeze it with both hands, forcefully expressing its contents into the intestine through the hole in the bag until all of the medicine has been evacuated. Then remove the bag and have the patient stand up, leaning against the wall for support.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces him to urinate, let him do so as much as he can; and if he sleeps with it for the entire night, it is even more helpful.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	But if you tie it in cases of abdominal effusion and urinary retention, then you should repeat the cautery until it is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if hemorrhoids or abscesses are present in the anus, then let the tying be very subtle and gentle, using the same kind of ties used for infants.
De curacio de las plaguas.	On the treatment of wounds.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	I have already said in the division of wound treatment what is necessary for this book, and now I will say the treatment of these with my hands and with medicines as appropriate.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore I say that wounds are diverse according to the cause of the wound and the location on which the wound is located.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes by which wounds are often made include falling from a height, cuts from a sword or knife, piercing with a spear, staff, or arrow, or other similar causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	But wounds on the parts of the body are also diverse, such as a wound that occurs on the head, neck, chest, stomach, hip, and other similar places on the limbs.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I am now recommending the treatment for certain wounds, so that you can apply this reasoning and rule to other wounds as well.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will begin with simple wounds of the head, as the memory of compound wounds will come at the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore I say that when a simple wound occurs on the head and it is not a fracture, then consider: if it was caused by falling from a height or similar, and if the skull has been crushed only slightly, and it is a large wound, and you fear that an abscess may form, then you should quickly perform venesection (the act of opening a vein to release blood) on the cephalic vein (located in the arm), without delay. And extract some blood according to the patient's strength, but not more if there is no other reason prohibiting venesection, especially if the blood that has come out from the wound is scant.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And let venesection be opposite to the wounded part, and take care that the patient avoids fullness, wine, and heavy foods.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	But if any cause prohibits from the minimum (venesection), then let food intake be reduced and do not approach meat or wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And place over the wound if an abscess has formed, cut it open and apply oil mixed with rose petals or wine that has been made sticky (coagulated).
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	But if you are sure that an abscess has not formed, then place over the wound, if it is fresh and still bleeding, with a small powder of the kind I will recommend later.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	But if the air has already changed (i.e., the wound has begun to heal), then place on it some ointments until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the wound is large or has been caused by a sword or similar, and its lips have not been brought together with stitches as I will recommend in the chapter on stitching, then bring them together with stitches as I will recommend on suture techniques.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	But if the wound has exposed bone and brain tissue, but is not retaining any fragments, only a small amount of support, then incise it and cure the wound with medicines, restore the flesh in place of the skull, and command the patient to avoid foods that are heavy or difficult to digest until they have healed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find putrefaction in the skull that does not adhere to the bone, then you should cut away all of it and remove it, and then cure it (the wound).
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	But if in these wounds there is an artery or vein from which blood can flow, and it has not been stopped by medicines, then you must look for the artery, and if you find it uncut, then you should cut it with a scalpel or tie it; and if necessity requires that what we have said does not work, then you should cauterize until the bleeding stops.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these wounds are simple and small, then the cause of them is light, so you should powder over it this powder, which will solidify before the air changes (i.e., the wound heals), preventing any infections from forming.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the method of making this powder is as follows: take one part oil of crushed roses, two parts dragon's blood resin, and three parts unburnt chalk; mix them together thoroughly and sift them, then fill the wound with it and constrict it with a good constriction until it adheres well to the wound and is coagulated by the blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And then you should strengthen it above with stitches and leave it alone until the wound is no longer swollen or infected, as the medicine will not be effective if the stitches are removed before the wound has healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And sometimes it is sufficient to use only crushed rose petals when crushed roses and dragon's blood are not available to you.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And this method is also used in large wounds when it is appropriate to place it on them and keep them tight, and these are fresh wounds with their own blood, which the air has not yet altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	But if the air has altered them, and especially in summertime, then it is not appropriate to use this powder. Instead, cure those wounds with what we have mentioned, such as placing ointments on them or using poultices made of flour and water mixed with honey until they dry up; and then heal those wounds with the other treatments until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	But if there is a fracture in the wound and it is small, then you should extract that with gentle force.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And I have said the treatment for head fractures in what is poisonous (i.e., dangerous).
De las plaguas del col.	Of the wounds of the neck.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the wound occurs in the neck, then there is no difference in treatment compared to wounds of the head when they are simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerves or arteries in the neck have been cut, then if it is nerves, there is no need to sew them up but rather avoid treatment that causes strong coagulation, such as using zinc and quicklime (calcium oxide), which are known as vitriol and similar substances, so as not to damage the nerves and cause contraction.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not place anything cold on the wound, for the substance of nerves is sensitive and its connection to the brain is delicate, which is the control center of all members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if it is that light medicines are used for the cure, such as warm water baths, sometimes infused with essential oils, and rubbing the body when bathed in warm water and other similar remedies, and using heated ointments.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	But if the wound is large, then stitches should be administered or the lips of the wound brought together, and then cure it with powders until it heals.[translation notes] "sutura" comes from latin sutura which means a sewing. In medical context it refers to surgical stitching or suture.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if the wound is deep or if pus has formed in its lower part, then lance it in the most sunken place.[translation notes] "perfora" comes from latin "perfodio" which means "to dig through". In medical context it refers to making a hole or opening through a structure.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	But if an artery has been cut in the wound and there is bleeding, then either separate it, or tie it off, or cauterize it if necessary.[translation notes] "inscisa" comes from latin "incisus" which means 'cut'. Here it refers to a cut artery.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the vertebrae of the spine have been cut and saved the veins of the neck, then suture the edges of the dura mater (the outermost membrane surrounding the brain and spinal cord) over the edge of the wound in the spine and do not touch it; gently pull it together and return it to its natural shape, and then strengthen it with proper support and leave it alone for several days; and cure it with ointments that contain styptic (astringent) properties until it heals.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	But if the wound has damaged the bone, then percuss it (strike it gently with a medical instrument to test its condition), and if there are any bone fragments in it, remove all that you can; and what you cannot use, leave it inside until the wound dries up, becomes separated, and the swelling is relieved.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the wound is fresh, then sprinkle powder made from the recommended substance over it.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if a fistula has formed in the wound, then cure it with what is recommended for this condition, as described in its own chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Regarding wounds to the neck or similar ones located between the shoulders, caused by a spear, sword, or lance, etc.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a wound caused by a lance or sword, and sometimes its depth is visible, then consider if the patient experiences shortness of breath from the wound; if so, know that the wound is fatal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	But if it is not deep and the wound is fresh with its own blood, then in the first hour you should sprinkle powder on it, but do not press hard to prevent the blood from being retained in the depth of the wound and returning to the heart, which could harm the patient. Instead, apply an attractive ointment, and unbind it (the dressing) twice a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	But if the ointment is not available, then you should apply a clean cloth to the wound to absorb any moisture and make sure the patient lies on the wound so that any pus in it can drain out.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	But if three days or more have passed since the wound and there are no symptoms of spasm, trembling in the heart, or tightness in the chest, and other good signs are present, then you should know that the wound is healing; and from now on care for it with warm compresses and other treatments until it is healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if healing is delayed and the wound remains open for a long time, then know that a fistula has formed; treat it according to its chapter (or section) in this textbook.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	If the wound is caused by a stab or cut from a sword or spear and is simple on the surface of the skin, then treat it with sutures if it is large, or with powder if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if the wound has damaged the bone and there are pieces of bone sticking out, then you should twist the wound to remove those bone fragments if they are loose.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not loose, then leave them inside so that the wound can heal and the removal of these fragments becomes easier.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for other wounds in other parts of the body, the aid in treatment is the same as what has been said (before).
De las plaguas del ventre.	Regarding wounds to the abdomen (ventre), here are some guidelines:
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The disorder that occurs in the abdomen can be either severe, mild, or moderate.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	In severe cases, sometimes the intestines or nerves of the intestines protrude, which requires more careful and precise suturing to reposition them properly.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	A small disruption is made difficult to correct in any other way, and I know that reducing them (the stones) is even more difficult, if you do not take care of the insertion of the stone back into its place immediately, because it becomes swollen and enlarged, making the insertion difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And so, the best disruption is a minor one, because in this case, reducing the intestine is not difficult, as it is in the two types mentioned before.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that there are four ways to suture the abdomen, but two of them are more common and suitable for suturing other wounds in the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other types of sutures are specific to abdominal wounds, but they are also used in other wounds, although they are more specific to the suture of the abdomen.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	I recommend to you an explanation and description (of the four types of sutures).
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	I say that when the wound is small and has come out for some reason due to the intestine, and it is difficult to reduce it, then it is one of two ways: either because of the small size of the disruption, as we have said, or when the intestine has become inflamed due to the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And so, when it is like this, it is necessary that you scrape it, submerging a sponge or a cloth wet in warm water only, or that you take it in stale water, chamomile, and dill, and introduce it with that to the intestine until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes it is done with styptic, and it is better than water alone in the resolution of inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And so, when you see the inflammation has been resolved, then you moisten the intestine with water in which elder and mallow have been boiled, because this eases the insertion of it with little difficulty.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if the insertion of it is excused, then you should cut the wound slightly with an instrument with which incised hemorrhoids are treated.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the primary cure is better when it is proper and not a section, and does not involve drying out necessary evacuation and shortcoming.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	About the instrument, see its form:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One part of it should be curved and sharp, and the other part not sharp, and the tip thin, but not as thin as a spatula, rather it should be slightly blunt.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And so, when the wound is large and the intestine has come out, then it is necessary that its reduction be according to its natural form, in its proper place, if possible, because this is better.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the disruption is wide and in the lower part of the abdomen, then it is necessary that the patient lies on their side, and you place their legs higher than their head; and if it is in the upper part of the abdomen, then you should place their head and chest higher than their hips.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And similarly, if the disruption is in one of the two parts of the abdomen, then always direct your attention and consideration towards that side so that the part where the wound is may be higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And this should be done in large wounds and in medium-sized wounds.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in small wounds, do what you are prepared to do and ensure that the person administering it is between your most trusted servants, who hold the wound with their hand and adjust its lips, and ensure that the suture is done for some reason or another.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common method of suture: one in which you take a needle or a threaded needle according to the quantity of the width of the wound; and then place it at the edge of the disruption of your ring finger, pull the needle once without inserting suture into both ends of the cord, with two ends of the silk that is after the cord of the inner parts, until you make it penetrate that part; and you have already connected two ends of the thread and two ends of the silk, and this has been done in four rows.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And then pull tightly with double thread in the circuit of the needle, and sometimes from both sides together, and also bring together the lips and wound with appropriate connection; and leave the width of your finger and insert another needle in that place, and tie it with thread as you did with the first needle; and do not stop doing this with the needles until you have completed stitching the entire length of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And let the needles be of medium thickness between coarseness and delicacy, because fine needles slightly cut the flesh, and thick ones are difficult to insert in the cord, and therefore they should be of medium thickness in terms of delicacy and coarseness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it is not necessary for the needle to be inserted too close to both ends of the cord because this may cause slight cutting of the flesh and make the wound open before its healing.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And let the sutures not be too long so that the wound is not prevented from healing.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then insert the ends of the needles so that they do not harm the patient while they sleep; and place over the suture expanded powders from all sides, which hold the ends of the needles; and leave them in until you are certain that the wound has healed.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And this type of suture with needles is more suitable for small wounds, because even in the suture of them one needle or two or around that number can be used.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	And the second common suture is that you administer with a suture the four ends of the cord and two ends of the silk in one go, with a needle on which fine thread is wrapped in delicacy and coarseness.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And then when you have penetrated these four ends with the needle, reduce the needle from that inner part from which you started, so that the thread pulls back towards the higher side of the wound, making the suture like a suture of cloth by which clothes are held together.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And leave between each suture the width of your little finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this suture is suitable for men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And with this type of suture, I sewed the wound that was inflicted on a man in his abdomen, who had been stabbed with a knife, and the size of the wound was larger than a palm, and the intestines had come out about two palms from the middle part of the intestine, and the disruption was in the middle of the member; and then I reduced it after the intestines had been outside the wound for twenty-four hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the wound healed within fifteen days or thereabouts, and I cured him and he recovered; and then he lived for many years, and was able to carry out his daily activities.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And other doctors had judged that he would not recover; and it was a miracle, because I did not cure him with ointment, because it was in a place where ointment was not found or any medicine, but I placed an old piece of cloth on the wound twice a day and washed it continuously with honey water until it was healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But I describe two types of specific sutures according to the account in the Bible.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And one type is that you start with a suture of the cord and insert the needle from the outer side to the inner side.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And so, when the needle penetrates the cord and that inner layer according to straightness and length of the entire body, leaving the end of the silk on which you have inserted the needle; then insert the needle in the other end from the inner side to the outer side in the other membrane.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And when you have done this once, then insert the needle again in that same end of the membrane from the outer side to the inner side; leave the end of the silk on this side and insert the needle in the other end of the inner side from the inner side to the outer side.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And insert it with that needle in the same way as you inserted it in the silk, making sure that everything penetrates inside.[improved]
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And then start from this same side and sew the other end of the silk in the opposite side, remove the needle from the cord that you inserted, and then return it to the cord, sewing the end of the silk on the opposite side with the end of the silk; and then remove the needle from the cord that was inserted.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And do this once and then again, repeating the process until you have sewn everything that is outside according to this example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the essence of this method of suturing is that you sew with a suture of pellicles, like you would sew fur, in such a way that you sew the silk once from the side of the end of the cord, leaving the other side open until you have completed it. [improved]
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	But the second type of specific suture that I mentioned, called "Gualian", is performed as follows: sew it with semi-thickness so that the medicines can be applied, in such a way that all parts are connected to their corresponding parts according to nature; and apply one end of it to the other end of it, and this is done as I have recommended to you. [improved]
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	It is necessary to insert the needle in the end of the silk outside, and make it penetrate inside the inner side of that same part, leaving two ends of the silk; then turn the needle around and make it penetrate from the outer side to the inner side in those two ends of the silk. [improved]
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	Then turn those around and make each of them penetrate from the inner side to the outer side in two ends of the silk that are on the opposite side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this method of suture is better than the common light one and is the suture that was mentioned before. [improved]
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the method of Gualian.
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And they said that the abdominal suture is corrected with two needles, which means that you insert into each of them a thread and start with the insertion of the needle from your side, making it penetrate to the other side according to the suture of those who sew leather with thread. [improved]
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And know that when the disruption is in the middle part of the abdomen, then the suture of it is more difficult than other parts of the abdomen. [improved]
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	The medication for a wound is also a judgment for other wounds.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	This is because when you obtain the wound with its pus before the air alters it, and return the intestines and parts of the body to their proper place and dress the wound appropriately, then apply a powder that promotes healing.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already affected the wound, then apply ointments that dry and harden it, causing it to form a scab, heal and be taken care of as with other wounds until it is healed.[ (Note: This seems to be saying to apply drying agents, such as ointment, to the wound if it has already become infected or inflamed.)]
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if you do not have the medicines present, then cover the wound immediately, since it begins to discharge pus and change its color twice a day, as has been taught to you, until it is healed, because you will not need other medicine in most cases when the wounds are simple.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	But if you fear that the wound may spread and cause injury to the main members (limbs), then it is advisable to soak a lamb's wool in a high-quality bath oil or rose oil, and place it on the affected area between the groin and just above the heels.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	And if there is pain or putrefaction in the intestines, which often occurs, then use a black stiptic (a type of wound-healing salve) made with vinegar, and especially if the powder has penetrated into the intestine and caused a perforation in its cavity.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	And know that a wound in the large intestine is more easily healed with less pus than one in the smaller intestines.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is difficult to heal because the intestine called "gallbladder" does not receive healing from wounds that penetrate it completely; and this is due to the large number of veins in it, and its large size, and due to the subtlety of its body, and its proximity to the nature of nerves.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	But if what comes out of the wound is fabric, and you obtain it recently, then return it to its place according to your best judgment, as you would with intestines.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	But if it has already passed through a space and turned green or black, then you should strengthen it with bile on the spot that is discolored by it, so that blood flows from it, because there are veins and arteries in the fabric.
