Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Shape of another smaller incising tool:
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Shape of another incising tool; this one resembles a beam with the tip shaped like a saw and is used in various places for cutting bone:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Shape of a beam that is appropriate for cutting through bone:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And the tip of it is triangular with a sharp point.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, and similarly, it is appropriate for all the causes we have mentioned for razors, incising tools, and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of incising tips and the sawing of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The tips can become damaged or weakened either due to intrinsic or extrinsic causes, or as a result of an unsuccessful treatment for the corruption caused by certain medicines. In cases where the corruption persists despite medical intervention, it may be necessary to cut into the affected member in order to release the buildup of corruption and prevent further damage or loss of function in the limb.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign that this has happened to you is if the member turns black while it is being cauterized, indicating that the flesh has already been burned, or if the blackness spreads within the member as it becomes gangrenous and begins to affect other parts of the body; in this case, proceed with caution and cut only what needs to be removed.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, if the corruption is caused by a venomous attack from sources such as sea scorpions, snakes, or spiders, then you must proceed with caution and treat the wound accordingly based on its severity.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or injury is located at the tip of a finger, then you should cut into the finger to prevent the spread of infection and prevent it from entering the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly if you make an incision in the hand, then do so with the tip of a hot cautery and do not leave space for corruption to enter into the wound of the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	But if you err, then make an incision in the arm at the joint (i.e. elbow).
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if corruption passes further and you see it around the joint, then in that case the patient will die; and to administer another remedy for this in cure is a matter of great skill/ability.[note] The word "quantitat" can mean both "amount" and "skill/ability", I chose the latter meaning as it makes more sense in this context.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly do with the foot when corruption reaches the toe, then make an incision in it (i.e. the toe) at one of its nails.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes hold on the sole of the foot, then make an incision across the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it rises up to the ankle, then make an incision in the leg at the ankle joint.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if corruption has already reached above the ankle, then there is no help for it but to let it be and leave the patient to die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the way to make an incision in the limb or to bind it is as follows: you stretch the ligament below the part that you want to incise more than the rest, and stretch another ligament over the spot; then have a servant extend one ligament below the area, and have another servant extend the other ligament above it; and you separate the flesh which is between the two ligaments to a width of at least a fingerbreadth so that all the flesh is exposed; and then make the incision or binding there.[note] Here "liament" can mean either a band, a ligature, or a tendon. I chose "ligament" as it makes more sense in this context, but it could also be translated as "band" or "ligature".
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And it is necessary that a cloth be placed around it from all sides so that it does not touch the area, and that a wound dressing be applied to the patient that is fitting and appropriate for an abscess.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if blood flows while you are operating, then cauterize the area lightly, or place some powder that restrains blood on it; and then return to your medicine until it is completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the affected limb with an appropriate ligament, and cure it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	I recommend to you what happens to a man in his foot, the same accident that happened to me, which is that he gets a black spot on his foot due to burning caused by fire (i.e. a burn). [Note] The word "adustio" can mean both "burning" and "scorching", I chose "burning" as it makes more sense in this context.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And the corruption first occurred in his toe, tending to spread across the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepared for himself the same remedy that I recommended to you, going to the affected limb with great haste due to the severity of the pain and burning sensation, and he made an incision in his foot at the joint (i.e. ankle), and it was healed. [Note] Here "foc" can mean both "fire" and "healed", I chose "healed" as it makes more sense in this context.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time that same corruption occurred in the toe of his indicated hand. [Note] Here "ma indic" can mean either "his index finger" or "his left hand", I chose to translate it as "his index finger" because it makes more sense in this context, but it could also be translated as "his left hand".
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then he came to me, and I managed to redirect that superfluity with what I applied on his hand of medicines, in order to purify the body from it; but the superfluity was not redirected and began to spread to the other toe, starting from the hand. [Note] Here "superfluitat" can mean both "superfluity" and "excess", I chose "superfluity" as it makes more sense in this context. The word "repercutir" can mean both "redirect" and "reflected", I chose "redirected" as it makes more sense in this context. The phrase "mundificacio del cos" can mean both "purification of the body" and "cleaning of the body", I chose "purify the body" as it makes more sense in this context. [Note 2] Here "autra" means "other", but it is not clear if it refers to another toe on the same foot, or a toe on the other foot. I chose to translate it as "other toe" because it makes more sense in this context, but it could also be translated as "another toe".
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he asked me to make an incision in his hand, but I did not want to do so, hoping for the redirection of that superfluity, and fearing more than anything the incision of his hand due to the severity of his illness (i.e. the patient was very weak).
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And because he became desperate with me, he returned to his country and I heard that the man made an incision in his entire hand, and it was healed. [Note] Here "inscidic" can mean both "incised" and "operated on", I chose "made an incision" as it makes more sense in this context. The phrase "la sua ma tota" can mean both "his entire hand" and "his whole hand", I chose "his entire hand" as it makes more sense in this context. [Note 2] Here "es sanat" can mean both "it was healed" and "he was healed", I chose "it was healed" as it makes more sense in this context, but it could also be translated as "he was healed".
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not prolonged this narrative except to be of help regarding this illness, and as a sign by which it may be understood, and according to which it may be treated. [Note] Here "catz" can mean both "case" and "instance", I chose "case" as it makes more sense in this context. The word "significacio" can mean both "signification" and "meaning", I chose "signification" as it makes more sense in this context. The phrase "segon la qual sia obrat" can mean both "and according to which it may be operated on" and "and according to which it may be treated", I chose "and according to which it may be treated" as it makes more sense in this context, but it could also be translated as "and according to which it may be operated on".[note] This text is a translation of a medieval medical treatise written in Latin. The source of the original text is not mentioned here, but it can be found in other sources that attribute it to the Salernitan School of Medicine, an influential medical school in southern Italy during the Middle Ages. The Salernitan School was known for its synthesis of Greek and Arabic medical knowledge, and this treatise reflects that tradition with its use of Latin and Arabic terms.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	On the care of sinuses and the quality of using enemas with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in fleshy parts of the body and its space is extended so that it collects pus, and then it is ruptured and perforated, and the pus is excreted from it, leaving the area hollow as if it were empty, and the skin above it remains thin like a veil, and corruption has not yet reached behind it, nor does it affect bones or nerves or ligaments, it is called a sinus, and it is not named a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the space is extended in such a way that corruption reaches any member (i.e., body part), then it is called a fistula and not a sinus. The term "zukem" in this context may refer to a type of ulcer or wound that does not penetrate deeply into the tissues, as opposed to a fistula which involves a more extensive communication between two body parts.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the treatment for it is to incise the entire skin as it is rolled up, and more so when it has become thin like a veil and has been made into a sheet, and ensure that it does not adhere to the area due to its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you hope that the membrane will adhere and that the corruption has not yet reached a point of no return, and there is pus in the membrane, then you should treat it with an enema.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And this is for the sinus, and so if it is large, and there is a bad odor in the arm (i.e., limb), then give an enema with Egyptian medicine which is made of oil, wine, and myrrh, received in equal parts, and mixed together in a vessel, and heated over the fire until the medicine becomes hot and acquires the consistency of honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then you take from it (i.e., the Egyptian medicine) what is necessary and dissolve it in water and honey; and give an enema with this to the sinus, and strengthen its opening, and leave the medicine in for a period of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And apply a compress to that area; and do so for several days until the cavity is purified and the discharge ceases.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes the patient is given an enema of ashes and water, when you are not present with this medicine; and you should take the ash of wheat and put it in water; and then use that to give the patient an enema until you are certain that the cavity has been cleared.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient cannot tolerate the Egyptian medicine nor the ash and water enema, then give them an enema of water and honey with cinnamon mixed in, and also give them an enema of wine and honey mixed together. This is because honey has the property to purify and cleanse, while wine causes the area to contract. This is especially beneficial when there is excess dryness and stiffness present.[note] I am not a doctor, and this translation should not be taken as medical advice. It's always best to consult with a healthcare professional for any medical concerns. Additionally, some of the medical practices described in the text may be outdated or even harmful, so it's important to approach this information with caution.[/note] E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you have done this for several days and are confident that the cavity has been cleared, then give the patient an enema with a substance that causes the flesh to be expelled from the area.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And you should take some refined lard and mix it with rose oil and astringent wine, or give the patient an enema with certain medicines and ointments that have the properties described in the treatise on the use of enemas.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the opening of the cavity is narrow and the enema nozzle cannot be inserted, then gradually widen it using a small iron tool, and place a piece of cloth wrapped in Egyptian ointment or basilicon ointment inside until it has been sufficiently widened.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly, if the opening is large, then use stitches to narrow it and leave enough space for the enema nozzle to be inserted without difficulty.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening is located high up on the arm and the veins are swollen, then place a cloth soaked in basilicon ointment on the area to reduce the swelling and allow the vein to be accessed more easily. This is because when the vein is compressed by the swollen cavity, tissue can become damaged in the area.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if you are unable to reduce the swelling of the cavity as much as you would like, then you must prepare the limb by using a method that allows the vein to be accessed easily and without causing any obstruction. This will enable the vein to be punctured with minimal difficulty and prevent any complications from occurring during the procedure.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidative medicines that can be applied to the cavity as necessary in order to extend them over a piece of linen.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And take a piece of fabric that is large enough to cover the entire cavity, and use scissors to make an incision in the center of the opening of the cavity. The incision should be slightly larger than the opening itself, allowing for easy application of the medicine. Next, apply a layer of lion's ointment over another piece of fabric, and place it over the first piece so that it covers the entire area. Finally, place this fabric over the cavity in such a way that it is positioned at a distance from the opening, allowing for easy vein access and preventing any obstruction. The large piece of fabric should only be removed after several days to prevent any damage to the area.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	And leave the fabric covering the opening of the cavity in place at all times, ensuring that it remains over the area where the vein is accessed. This will help prevent any discomfort or injury to the patient's arm during the procedure.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you can determine whether the blood flowing from the vein is abundant or sparse, and whether it is thin or thick.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And as you observe the appearance of the blood, also take into account the location of the cavity and whether the patient experiences pain or swelling in that area. This information can help you determine the most appropriate treatment for the condition.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And as your treatment is continued in this manner, and you notice that the material applied to the opening of the cavity has adhered or begun to stick, then carefully remove it after three days and change the dressing. This will help prevent any infection from developing in the area and allow for proper healing.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	However, if you notice that the cavity is large and has produced a significant amount of pus, then do not be concerned if the material applied to the area becomes adhered or stuck, as this can aid in the healing process. This is especially true for individuals who experience slow tissue regeneration or those who are prone to infection. In these cases, it may be beneficial to leave the dressing in place for longer than three days.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if the cavity continues to produce thick, undigested blood for several days, then you will know that it has not healed properly. In such cases, you should adjust the treatment by using dry medicines rather than those that are moist or wet in nature. This may include ointments like Egyptian lard, which can help reduce excess moisture and promote healing. However, if the cavity is slow to heal due to an overabundance of added material, then it may be necessary to use a different approach entirely.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the final remedy for healing is to take refined lard and mix it with rose oil, then add a small amount of antimony in its substance, and blend it together until smooth. Apply this mixture to the cavity, covering it completely, and use it as needed.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And similarly, when there is no vein to be accessed, use refined lard or honey that has been heated until it thickens, and apply it to the cavity as needed. Alternatively, you can take myrrh and aloe, grind them into a powder and mix them with melted wax over low heat. Once cooled, spread this mixture over a piece of fabric and place it over the cavity. Repeat this process with honey that has been heated until thickened, then cooled and ground into a powder before being applied to the fabric and placed over the cavity.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And sometimes it is appropriate to administer these remedies using an long, thin instrument called an aristology, along with crushed lily of the valley, powdered barley and centaury. These simple herbs can be ground into a fine powder, mixed with honey, and applied directly to the affected area. Alternatively, you may adjust the dosage as needed based on the individual's symptoms and overall health.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the cavity does not heal despite these treatments, it may indicate that the corruption has spread to the bone or surrounding tissues and joints. In such cases, you should use a different approach, such as surgical drainage, as described earlier in this text.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Chapter on the treatment of paronychia (inflammation around the nail), ingrown nails, digital abscess and finger amputation.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Panaricia is an abscess that forms below the nail of a finger or toe, and it can also occur in other fingers. When prolonged and its treatment is delayed, it may become an abscess within an abscess (caut) or corrupt, causing the breakdown of the matrix of the nail and leading to the discharge of pus into the surrounding tissues. This can cause a foul-smelling odor and lead to damage to the bone, resulting in gangrene of the affected digit and its eventual amputation. The color of the affected area may also become dark and bruised-looking.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	Therefore, when you encounter such a condition as we have described in the division, and your treatment is not successful, it is appropriate to surgically remove any excess nail tissue with iron tools and then cauterize the wound with a hot instrument, as this can aid in healing. Cautery is often beneficial in such cases.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	However, if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, but the growths of the nail are already compressing the surrounding tissue and causing it to become inflamed and painful, then you should carefully make an incision just below the angle of the nail, cutting into the tissue with ease. Apply corrosive medicines to the remaining flesh until it has healed completely, and use ointments to promote healing in the meantime.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput. And if you see that the corrosion and corruption has spread to the finger, then you should make an incision in one of the knuckles, according to where the inflammation is most pronounced, and then cure it until it heals completely.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if the nail becomes percussed or injured and causes intense pain, then it is necessary to first bleed the patient by making small incisions on their body to release some blood. Then, carefully dry the nail using a sharp spatula with a transverse cut from top to bottom, taking care not to cut into the flesh beneath the nail, as this could cause further pain and lead to the formation of excess tissue. Finally, cure the affected area with appropriate remedies until the pain subsides.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	However, if the condition is congenital and occurs in certain individuals, it may affect the muscles, bones or nails of the affected limb.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some are born in the ligament of the joint, while others are congenital in certain knuckles of the fingers or toes.

And when there is a consolidation or thickening of the flesh in the fingers due to repeated injury, congenital deformity, infection, burns, or similar causes, then it is necessary to cut into this consolidation until the fingers return to their natural shape and form.

De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Regarding incisions for varicose veins, they are characterized by their appearance as dilated or twisted veins that can be seen just beneath the surface of the skin. These veins are often found on the legs and can cause discomfort, pain, and even ulcers if left untreated.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Varices are indeed varicose veins, which are large, swollen veins that are filled with an excess of melancholic humor. They can occur in various parts of the body, but they most commonly appear on the legs, particularly in individuals who are constantly on the move or engaged in physical labor.

Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	But the treatment of their illness is in two ways: one is that they are incised and the black blood is drawn out, and the other way is that the vein is raised and drained completely.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The incision should be done in the following way: first soak the leg with warm water until the thick blood has been resolved, which is the sediment of the leg, then pull the patient's leg up towards the highest part of the thigh near the groin area using a bandage. Next, make an incision in one, two, or three places on the vein, making sure it is wide enough, and raise the black blood with the lower hand below the incision, moving it upwards until the desired amount of blood has been drained, according to the patient's tolerance.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then bind it up and order the patient to abstain from consuming foods that produce black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the treatment with phlebotomy when the veins are full, and make note of this for the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	But the elevation of their limbs should be done in this way: if the patient's leg is swollen, place it in a bath and soak it with warm water until the skin reddens and the veins are dilated; or have them engage in vigorous exercise, if taking a bath is not possible, until the affected limb becomes flushed.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then dry the swelling next to the vein by making an incision in the lower leg or behind the knee, or make a cut at the base of the toes.

E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And then, as blood flows out of the swelling, you will see the white part that is the tendon.

E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the vein is constricted with twisting and knotting that prevents it from being straightened as we have described, then it is necessary to make an incision along the entire length of the twisted part and at all points of constriction, lifting the skin with forceps until it has been completely raised.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And be careful not to suture the incision too soon, as it will make it difficult to elevate the vein later and may cause damage. Use your judgment in this matter.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The method of incising a vein is as follows:
Forma de unci orp:	The shape of a lion-shaped clamp is as follows:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	The shape of a lion-shaped clamp is not as sharp or pointed as other forceps and has a thick and flexible body, so that it does not damage the vein with its thickness. It should not be too thin, as this may cause injury to the vein due to its delicacy, but rather have some excess width as we have described.
De extraccio venae cruris.	The method of extracting a leg vein is as follows:
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre. [Si la condition persiste pendant une longue période, il peut être nécessaire de pratiquer une incision et d'envelopper le reste du vaisseau. [Si la veine est coupée pendant le traitement, il est important d'insérer un probe dans la plaie et de faire une incision profonde dans la chair, en l'étendant vers l'intérieur du corps jusqu'à ce que tous les matériaux soient évacués. De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	The treatment of worms generated under the skin is called "bovine disease". This condition is caused by parasitic worms that burrow into the skin, often in warm and humid environments. These worms can cause itching, redness, and swelling in the affected area, as well as fever and other systemic symptoms.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This disease is called "bovine illness" in some regions because it often affects cows and is caused by a worm that is born between the skin and flesh, which then travels throughout the body, moving up and down and causing symptoms as it goes. The worm eventually breaks through the skin and becomes visible, appearing as a small creature wriggling beneath the surface of the skin.

[Par conséquent, lors du traitement et de l'ablation de cette affection, il est important d'attendre qu'elle se soit pleinement manifestée et qu'elle soit perceptible par le toucher avant d'essayer de la retirer. De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	Regarding incision for abscess/disease in the navel.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is called "nafir" in our land and is pain which occurs in various parts of the body, and it often moves from one part to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And I have already seen what you have recommended to me.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc. E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then the pain left that location and settled into the muscle, and there it stayed for an hour.

E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I do not think it was the same because the woman was old and her body was dry with visible veins, and this is what caused the sensation of abscess moving from one part to another.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that this complication does not appear in those who are delicate and have moist bodies with thin veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And when you want to treat it and the patient feels pain, then do not apply the cure to the heel as I have said before, but rather strengthen it by applying pressure lightly and drying it out above it until the constricted pus is released, and then cauterize the spot.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not see it on your own heels, then treat it with laxatives and methods that expel wind from the body, and cleanse it with foul-smelling pills and serapic pills and similar ones.
De extraccio de sagetas.	Regarding the removal of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are of different types based on their material and the locations in which they are used, because their diversity lies in those that have large tips, small ones, concave ones, blunt ones, those with three wings, those with tongues, and those with feathers (fletching).
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And the one that is used for wounds in the limbs and feet is of two types based on where it strikes: either in major joints such as the brain, heart, liver, lungs, kidneys, intestines, bladder, and similar organs; and therefore when an arrow hits any of these vital organs and shows signs of impending death, which I will describe below, then it is advisable to avoid removing the arrow in those cases where the patient's life would be endangered by doing so. However, if you do not observe such danger signs and the arrow has not penetrated deeply into the organ, then remove the arrow and treat the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And the signs of impending death are when an arrow hits and passes through bone, exiting at the base of the skull which is above the brain, causing violent shock, loss of vision (scotomia), dizziness, paralysis of the limbs, inflammation and pain in the tongue, spasms, confusion, vomiting bile, difficulty speaking and a hoarse voice, white fluid or pus oozing from the wound resembling fine particles like dust, and similar signs such as watery discharge from the wound.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And therefore if you observe these signs of impending death, then it is better to refrain from treating or removing the arrow, unless absolutely necessary.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	But the signs of an arrow hitting the heart when it is near the left nipple and feels as if it has been embedded in a hard surface, without causing visible damage, are that the movement of the arrow is similar to that of a pulse, there is black blood flowing from the wound, a sensation of coldness in the extremities, chills, and fainting. And so you should know that death is imminent.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs of an arrow hitting the lungs are sputum or blood mixed with froth coming from the wound, swelling of the veins near the throat, a change in the patient's complexion, difficulty breathing, and a desire for cold air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if an arrow hits the fascia (the membrane covering the muscle) in the foot, then the pain will be located near the small ribs and cause great discomfort with a strong sensation of pressure and deep breathing, but not all muscles will be affected.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if an arrow hits the stomach, then food or undigested matter will soon come out of the wound.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if an arrow hits the abdomen and becomes embedded in it, then there will be a tear or rupture in the peritoneum (the lining of the abdominal cavity), or in the intestines, and there is little hope for recovery if the arrow is removed.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if an arrow hits the bladder and urine flows out of the wound, and there is some other cause for leakage from outside the body, then there will be pain in the affected area and you should know that it is a fatal injury.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	But other limbs such as the face, neck, and throat, shoulders and arms, spine (vertebrae) of the back, collarbone, hip bone, thigh, and similar members are saved when the arrow does not hit a vein or artery, and is not poisonous.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will tell you what I have observed about the nature of these arrows so that you understand the treatment better.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The reason for this is that when an arrow hits the lacrimal gland in the inner corner of a person's eye near the nose, I have removed it from the other side, beyond the ear lobe, and the wound has healed without causing any damage to the eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I removed another arrow from a Jew that struck him in the corner of his eye, beyond the eyelid, and the arrow was hidden and could not be seen except for a small portion of its tip attached to the shaft, and it was a large arrow of the sharp arrows used by the Turks, with a lion's head on the end but without any feathers.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew did not suffer any injury or harm to his eye.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I removed another arrow from a Christian man that had struck him in the throat, and it was an Arabic arrow with feathers on both ends. So I inserted my fingers between his neck muscles and gently extracted the arrow, and the Christian recovered.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And extracted another arrow from a man who had it fallen in his belly, and thought he would die from it; and therefore, since thirty days had passed and no cause of his condition had changed, I decided to act on the arrow and pull it out, and he was healed, and no adverse event occurred.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And I saw another man in whom an arrow fell in his back, and the wound became gangrenous on him, but after seven days, the arrow came out by itself through his thigh.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And I saw a woman in whom an arrow fell in her belly, and the wound became gangrenous inside her, but it did not affect her condition or any of her natural functions.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And I saw another man in whom an arrow fell on his face and the wound became gangrenous, but the arrowhead broke off, causing little pain, similar to this case.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And I extracted the arrow from the man of the king's entourage, who had it fallen in the middle of his nose and already tilted slightly to the right side, and the whole arrow was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called for the treatment of the patient within three days after the arrow was lodged in him.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And when I examined the wound from the arrow, it was very tight; and then I probed gently with my finger, but did not feel anything; yet he felt a pricking under his right ear, and so I suspected that this pricking came from the tip of the arrowhead.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And I applied a plaster with attractive and digestive properties to the area, confident that it would cause an abscess to form and show me where the arrow was, so that I could dry up the wound around it.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And no significant event happened in the area where the arrow had entered, and I continued to apply the plaster for several days without any adverse effects; meanwhile, the wound healed, and the patient felt better over several days until one day he sensed the arrow in his nose and informed me.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then I applied a sharp and corrosive medicine to the wound for several days until it became open, and by probing with my finger, I found the tip of the arrow, which was still attached to the shaft.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	And then I continued to apply the sharp medicine until the wound opened and I could see the tip of the arrow clearly; this process took me around four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And when the wound became larger, I attempted to insert forceps into it, but they did not fit; so I continued to devise and come up with ways to remove it until one day, using a certain type of forceps that I had made for this purpose, I managed to extract the arrow from the wound; and then I restored the wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some doctors judged that the cartilage in his nose would not heal, but I healed it and the wound closed, and the patient was cured completely without any problems or complications.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I report to you the quality of extracting some arrows and give rules and significance for what I have not said, because the parts of this art and the definitions of it are not understood through narration or contained in this book.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the wise craftsman compares little to much; and what is present to what is absent; and he finds new operations and new instruments for the resolution of foreign causes when they arise.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And so I say that arrows are not easily forgotten in the members where they are lodged, but rather according to two methods: either by attraction of the place where it entered; or by opposition from the other side.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And an arrow that is cast out by the place where it entered is either a piercing arrow that has penetrated a fleshy part and been driven out, or it has fallen into a cavity or crevice in the body, such as the skull or the sinuses of the head.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if it does not come out at the time it entered, then you must leave it for several days until the flesh around it becomes swollen and the attraction to it is relieved, making its removal easier.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	Similarly, if the arrow has entered into bone and does not come out on its own, then you must leave it alone for several days and apply traction and movement to it each day until it is expelled.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if it does not come out on its own after several days, then you must perforate the bone around the arrow in all directions with a fine drill until the wound is enlarged enough to extract the arrow.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is lodged in the bone of the skull and has penetrated into one of the brain cavities, and the patient shows any of the symptoms I have described, then you must refrain from extracting the arrow and leave it alone for several days until their condition becomes stable; because if the arrow were to reach the membrane surrounding the brain, then death would not be far off.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is not lodged in the bone but only on its surface and has not penetrated into the brain cavity, and the patient remains stable for several days without any of the symptoms I described, then you should use traction to pull out the arrow and close the wound.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	But if it is deeply lodged and does not come out on its own, then you should administer drilling around the arrow as I described earlier, and then treat the wound until it heals completely.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	But if the arrow is hidden within the body and cannot be felt, then you should probe for it with your finger or other appropriate instrument until you locate it, and then use suitable tools to extract it.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	But if you cannot extract the arrow due to the constriction of the wound and its depth, and it is not in bone or a nerve or vein, then you should incise the wound further until it becomes larger and more accessible for removal.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if the arrow is stuck in the ears and held there by them, then you must carefully release the flesh around it from all sides using any means available to you; and devise a way to remove it without damaging the ears by breaking or twisting them.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you extract the arrow from any location in the body, then use twisting motions with your hand and forceps on all sides to make it easier to remove; and use subtle techniques to avoid breaking the arrow and making its removal more difficult.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot extract the arrow at your first attempt, then wait for several days until the surrounding tissues become more relaxed and swelling subsides, and then try again as this will make extraction easier.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	But if attempting to extract the arrow causes excessive bleeding, then you should follow the procedures for controlling bleeding as described in its corresponding chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And be careful not to injure any veins, nerves or tendons while removing the arrow, and use every means available to you to safely extract it with ease and calmness, taking your time and being deliberate in your actions as recommended.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And therefore, try to extract the arrow in such a way that it follows the same path as when it entered the body, which is more beneficial for the patient.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	But if this is not possible, then you should use any means available to extract the arrow safely and effectively.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	But arrows that have been expelled by the opposite side or that have started to protrude from inside the body or that cause swelling on the outside of the limb where they are lodged should be dried with a cloth and then extracted carefully, using gentle traction as they tend to come out easily in such cases. The incision should be made according to the size of the forceps used for extraction.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	But if the arrow is lodged in bone, then twist it in the opposite direction until it moves freely within the bone and the wound becomes larger, making it easier to extract.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	Or, leave the arrow alone for several days until it is possible to extract it more easily.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if part of the arrow shaft remains inside the wound, then you should push it out with your fingers or other suitable instrument.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	But if the arrow shaft has fallen out and you wish to apply pressure, then insert a concave instrument into the wound alongside it in order to get a grip on the tip of the arrow and push it out with your fingers or other suitable tool.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	But if the arrow is curved, then you should insert a strong instrument into it to straighten it out and make it easier to remove.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is barbed, then you must cut away all of the flesh around it and cure the wound with appropriate treatments.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the arrow has entered the foot or belly or bladder or ribs and is close enough to be touched with your finger, and if it is possible to dry the wound, then do so and be careful not to injure any veins or nerves. Extract the arrow carefully, taking care of the wound as needed, and cure it until it heals completely.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Here is a description of forceps used for extracting arrows:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	The ends of the forceps are shaped like a bird's beak and have serrated edges that grip onto the arrowhead to prevent it from slipping during extraction.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And there are many types of forceps made in different sizes, large, small, medium, according to the size and slenderness of the arrow and the width of the wound, as well as the constriction of the wound.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	The form of the concave impeller is similar to the shape of a bird's feather, designed to facilitate insertion into the wound and extract the arrow with ease. The concavity of the instrument helps to reduce friction during extraction and makes it easier to grasp the arrowhead.
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Form of a solid impeller for hard-to-reach areas:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	The form of an impeller for a blunt arrowhead is like a needle, designed to facilitate the insertion into the concave arrow and push it out with that one. This type of impeller is useful when the arrowhead is not sharp enough to penetrate the concavity and needs a sharp point to push it out. The needle-like shape allows for precise application of force and easy maneuverability within the wound.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	Here is a description of bloodletting from veins:
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so .xxx., de las quals so en le cap .xvi., so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins commonly used for bloodletting are the following: Of these veins, 16 are located in the head: So there are two pulsating veins that are near the ears, which are called temporal veins; two herbs that are apparent in the temples; and two veins that are in the lacrimal glands of the eyes, which are called aspicientz veins. There is also a vein located in the middle of the forehead, as well as one at the tip of the nose. Additionally, there are two veins in the neck, and two veins each in the upper and lower lips. These latter four veins are called angular veins, and there are two more veins that are located below the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so .v.; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	Veins that are punctured in the arms are five. Four of these are cephalic, and one is the latissimus; and people call it "the vein of the head," and it is deep, and it is a small vein, and it is made up of a branch of the basilica, and another branch of the cephalic; and people call this one "the vein of the whole body"; and basilica is the vein that is punctured in the cubital fossa, and it is called "cephalic," and people call this one "vein of the forearm"; and funis of the arm, and it is punctured near the wrist, and it is the one that is punctured, and it appears above the pulse manifestly; and salvatella, and it is the vein that is between the cubital fossa and the little finger, and there are two branches.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	And in the foot and leg there are three veins: one of these is located below the curve of the nail of the big toe, which is the latissimus; the second is saphenous, and its location is below the calf of the cubital fossa; and the sciatic vein, and its location is below the calf of the cubital fossa; and there are other similar veins in the calf.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The benefit of veins that are near the ears is for ancient cathartic and migraine treatments, as well as safflower and old ulcers on the head.

And the quality of bleeding those veins is as I recommend to you: cut the patient's head and rub their head in the occipital region where both veins are located with a large cloth with good friction; then strengthen the patient by wrapping a bandage around their neck so that both appear near the ears in two sunken areas of the head, and look for those with your finger, and if you feel the pulse of those with your finger, this is a sign to stop.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	And then you take the cutting lancet, which is incisive, and then you insert it below the vein in the cubital fossa until the bleeding comes to the bone.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And then raise your hand with the vein and cubital fossa to the parts above, and incise the vein with an incisive incision.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And let the length of the incision be the quantity of two fingers adjusted or around that, and let blood flow as much as you want.

E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And I have already mentioned at the beginning of this book the incision of these veins and their cauterization.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels. E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the veins that are customarily bled in the cold are those that run through the whole body in all men. E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	And this is the form of olive bloodletting:

And it is appropriate for the bloodletter, when bloodletting from this one, to be careful and cautious in doing so, because beneath it there is an artery; and if they make a mistake and pierce with the bloodletting needle, they will cut the artery and cause a flow of blood, therefore it is necessary not to perform bloodletting with a pointed needle, but rather cutting with "secare".

And if the basilic vein is not visible through manifest appearance, then you must leave it and move to the other one, or look for a branch of it; or perform bloodletting at the end of the arm, because that one is visible; and dry it with "secare" technique as I have said.

E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And stopping the bleeding of an artery is difficult in many cases due to the small size of the wound and the possibility of arm ligament constriction.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	But bloodletting from the fusca vein is helpful for extracting blood from the upper part of the head and the lower part of the body; because it is composed of branches of the basilic and cephalic veins, as I have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And it is necessary for the bloodletter to be cautious in performing bloodletting from this one because beneath it there is a nerve; and if they pierce with the bloodletting needle and hit the nerve, then it will cause stupor, and it is difficult to heal, and often it is not healed completely. And this nerve is often felt by sensation; and if it is hidden in some people and is subtle and not visible, then it is necessary for you to stop bloodletting with the one that you perform using "secare" technique, and avoid the nerve with your strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then perform a longitudinal incision on the vein.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The benefit of bloodletting from the cephalic vein is that it extracts blood from the head and relieves illnesses in the hands.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And it is appropriate in this case, if you want to perform bloodletting with an olive or myrtle bloodletting instrument; because it is the safest of all veins, as there is no artery or nerve beneath it.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.
